text: You can never go wrong with the bulgogi nachos.  The chips are always crisp,  toppings are plentiful and portion size will fill you up. The fusion beef sliders with fries are great. Who knew a bulgogi cheesesteak would be so delicious, they did that's why it's on the menu. I love getting the pork belly skewers as an appetizer. I always leave full and satisfied with some leftovers to take home.
Excellent food, great service, clean place, friendly people. If you want good food and more than ample servings, Komex is the place.

One of my favorite places to get lunch when I don't feel like cooking. 
These ladies are very nice. And so are the cooks. Last time I went, I ordered to go, they comped me some free chips, salsa and guacamole!!! Which all were so delicious!!! 
If they had delivery service, they would have even more business!!!
And btw... Their portions are huge!!!!!
Was okay, nothing special... fries were overly topped and soggy. Bulgogi had good flavor. Kim chi fried rice full portion was huge but not much flavor and greasy.

Outstanding!

The food was excellent - we were looking for something different on a weeknight, and were pleasantly surprised.

Service was prompt and friendly.  The portions are generous, a good value for sure,

We will be back!
I went here when I had family in town.  Great food and interesting fusion of Korean and Mexican food.  I thoroughly enjoyed the meal as did my family members.  We'll be back for sure!

The idea of this place to me is better than the actual place. I was really looking forward to some bulgogi and kim chi fried rice.  Both were pretty good, but really nothing too special. The lady working today was really nice

Amazing!! My husband ordered the bacon fried rice after hearing rave reviews about it. It was a giant bowl of amazing! 
I ordered the fusion beef enchilada plate. I was in heaven! I was expecting just plain ground beef, but the different cut they used was delicious! 
The size of the meals are perfect! We left with full and happy stomachs! 
Next visit I plan on trying the tater tot bowl (I can't remember the name) that was advertised on the front of the menu!

This place is excellent. The food was delicious. Not very expensive. Your full when your done. The staff was so friendly and kind. Never had to wait for anything. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.

This is my favorite fusion! Korean delicious beef & Mexican style. I highly recommend anything on the menu. The owners are so friendly and customer service oriented. Try it out your belly will thank you!

Komex is about as good as it gets for casual quick eats. The shrimp and pork belly tacos and the spam kimchi fried rice is my usual order and its all awesome. The price is more than fair and the service always above average. Try it!
A very nice Korean Mexican fusion dishes, that is nice if you want to get off the strip, and is very well priced. I fed 6 people for $85. That would never happen in the strip.
Komex,  definitely doesn't disappoint food is always consistently good. The kim chi fried rice and bulgogi sliders are my favorites.  Best of all they serve beer!..

Tasty little joint safe to try for those who may of the less adventurous sort. Definitely ask for the house made salsa makes everything even more tasty. Bring your appetite and loosen that belt portions are generous. I will be back!

This is definitely a place you have to try for yourself, if you're are into or require the following: 

a) greasy food
b) an option to fast food
c) high calories
d) a good hangover food

If your'e into healthy eating, then this is probably not the place for your.  The food was alright, but I felt so guilty and had to add extra time to my workout just to balance things out.  I didn't even eat a quarter of my Kimchi fried rice (it was SUPER greasy, heavy and just probably exceeded over 1000 calories).  The pork lettuce wraps were yummy, but again, that guilt feeling took over and I only had one.  

If you could careless about the caloric intake and greasy foods, this is a better option than say Jack n' the Box or Panda Express and especially Taco Bell; but in my opinion it's comparable.

Try it for yourself; I did and don't think I'll be back, but at least I tried it.  

My fortune cookie was hilarious though, it read:

"Over prepare, then go with the flow" [in bed].  haha!

I LOVE Komex, the fusion of Korean and Mexican is great. I have tried several things on the menu and still come back. The flautas are one of my favorites. Even their Philly cheese steak and wings are good.

We were looking for a new place to try and came upon this fusion restaurant.  Service was great and food was pretty good.  The flavor of our entrees was good.  It's a casual place to eat and perfect for meeting up with friends.  There's even a happy hour and a bar.
Great food and great prices.   Never disappointed.  Grrat fusion if Korean and Mexican food.  Love the bulgogi fusion fries!

Food was awesome. The staff was great in taking our order amd getting our food out quickly. We had a group of 25 adults, teen and kids and we all enjoyed our food. As soon as we arrived our table was ready and when they took our order our food was out in a few minutes. Food was great and fresh. The complimentary chips are freaking good. Don't fill up on them because you will not be able to enjoy the food. The Bulgogi nachos rocked! The Kimchi Rice rocked! All the food that we ordered rocked. Sometimes going off the strip you find a great place to eat. Easy parking, no fussing with the casino and getting lost and for the cost of a buffet you can actually order a wide variety of their food and still have change!
i got bulgogi and shrimp tacos. bf got beef chimichonga. portions were generous for the price. flavors were amazing. service was great too. would definitely come back again.
This place is awesome.  I go to Vegas quite a bit and hate eating on the strip or ordering room service.  This place is a must is you consider yourself a foodie.
This place is awesome, food is really good prices are very responsible! I have the tostada with beef and chicken wings! The tostada was awesome, the wings where good too!!!!

Me gusta esta fusi√≥n de sabores.
Lo mejor... los tacos!!!.
La chimichanga .... riquisima!

Lo recomiendo ampliamente.

This is for takeout only.  Will reassess dine-in at some later point.  This Korean Mexican fusion really fills a culinary niche that I know will leave me with a very specific craving in the future.  Good size portions at a reasonable price.  I had the burrito w/chicken.  Adding a touch of he Korean sauce made for a delicious meal.  For you vegetarians, I understand that the veggie tofu fried rice is really good!

I don't get what the big deal is.  

We ordered a bunch of different things and honestly nothing stood out.  Food was bland.  Meat quality was subpar.  Restaurant interior was boring.  Won't be back.

Came in for lunch. Had 1 each of the tacos. Service was perfect. Tacos were very good. The restaurant met the high expectations I had prior to dining. Complimentary chips, salsa and guac were even good! Will come back often for lunch!
Great food.  Decor isn't the best, but if you want decor, go to the strip.  If you want great food, go here.

They start you off with chips and salsa. I ordered the Bulgogi cheesesteak with a single fish taco, sooo good my mouth is watering thinking about it.   A good change from eating on the strip and a lot less expensive. Clean, easy parking and friendly service.

Rhyming Review #iamnotarapper

Driving down Buffalo toward KoMex/
Kalbi plus Tacos, better than sex/
Ready to grub, got two spoons ready/
Kimchi fried rice got me drooling, steadily/
Spam was the choice I made for my meat/
Sit down and prepare for the feast in my seat/
Thanks to the korean fam who owns this spot/
Call in togo or wait for what you bought/
This aint fast food, its a real ass dinner/
they're a bit slow so just plan for similar..

Oh damn that shit was fire, bulgogi on point/
Got me feeling like a king i'll be back to this joint/
No need to fret, the foods hella good/
If you like rolling bulgogi up like a backwood/
huge burrito the size of your face/
after were done give me some space/
cuz i'm boutta rip a fart...

5/5 - FIRE!!! next time spam masubi w egg..

We came on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't very busy so service was very fast. Ordered bulgogi beef tacos and pork belly tacos. We took it to go so we didn't have a chance to try their complimentary chips and salsa but we did get their "chunky" salsa. The salsa has a hint of Korean flavors almost like a kimchi salsa and so hot I was almost seeing colors, I love it!. I've never had bulgogi style beef so I didn't know what to expect. It was tender and mildly sweet. It was plentiful and flavorful. The pork belly had a good flavor but it just didn't mesh well on a taco. I will dream of the bulgogi nachos tonight!

I've been meaning to go to Komex for a while and I'm glad I finally did! I got the half order teriyaki plate which was more than enough for me, I ended up taking some home. 

The waitress was cute and friendly. The chips and guac that they bring out are GOOD. I had to ask for more guac because my brother didn't want to share. 

We went in kind of late so it wasn't too busy. The only negative I can even think of was that as we were leaving there was a really gross old fish smell...it was really quite nauseating. It definitely wasn't there when we arrived otherwise I can't say we would have stayed, it was that bad.

However I'm not even sure it's the restaurants fault so I am still giving 5 stars and I would definitely recommend you eat here :)

No reason not to eat here. Looks to be a family owned place, inside is very clean, one good tv and a nice bar set up.  

Incredibly affordable prices and the food was super tasty. Had the sliders as an appetizer, and there was probably too much meat. I had the beef bowl with the fried egg on top. A combination of the spicy peppers and their Korean sauce had me sweating pretty good as I ate, and I loved it. 

Flautas were good too, 3 very good sized pieces. They also had Mexican coke in the glass bottle which is always nice. 

3 items + the coke was only $27. Felt like it should have been more for how good it was. Definitely will return.

I would go just for the complimentary chips and salsa/guac. Chips were great.

My husband and I stumbled across this place while looking for apartments. We were attracted to the name because we usually never come across any mexican/korean restaurant on our side of town. We both shared an order of the pork belly street style tacos and loved it! Customer service was awesome! We will definitely come back if we're  ever in the area!
I had the bulgogi nachos and the thing was massive. As I was eating it I was in a state of euphoria for about 20 minutes. It had a unique taste that I had never experienced and was very delicious.

From world of mouth via friends, I was looking forward to trying this place. It's a bit out of the way for me, but I found myself in the general area today and thought it would be a perfect time to check it out. We were there at 2 pm, the restaurant was completely empty. I was not deterred based on all the great reviews their N. Decatur location had received. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful on choosing what to order. I naturally wanted to eat everything - but managed to narrow it down to the bulgogi Fusion Chimichanga. Go big, or go home. Right? It was loaded with flavor! My friend tried a trio of meats (pork, chicken, steak) with the Fusion Enchiladas. We both loved our dishes, made even better by the quad of sauces brought to the table. I found the sweet chili, and the Asian style chili sauce to be the best toppings. 

Originally I had meant to order the biggest thing, and take a good portion home for my husband to try. (He was very jealous that we had gone without him.). But, I found myself inhaling the chimichanga and ended up just taking home the butt end of it. Sorry Hubs! I look forward to coming here again soon and trying more things. I have to add that my friend is quite particular in what she does and doesn't like, and she really loved her meal. 

 KoMex Fusion lives up to its hype. If you have schizophrenic taste buds like mine, you'll love this place. Sweet, spicy, salty, savory....yummmmm.  I can't wait to come back!

This second location simply does not compare to the first location, which I love.  My fiance and I went there the day after the "grand opening" and ordered kimchi fried rice and bulgogi burrito.  Burrito - we were not sure if the meat was even marinated.  Kimchi fried rice - just meh.  I might have had the food poisoning - I puked up everything that night.  Also, there were only 2 other tables, but the service was still agonizingly slow.  I really can't think of anything nice to say and not sure why there are so many glowing reviews.  NOT RECOMMENDED.
Best food for the price in Vegas. Spoo yummy. Definitely worth the 10-minute drive from the strip.

I come here on my way home from work and order something for to go. I've had several of their dishes and all are excellent!  Every time I come here, I always order their musubi.  One spam and one pork belly musibi, they are awesome!  The service is always excellent and very friendly!
Had to wait a while, but the waitress definitely made up for in and was courteous that we were in a time crunch. I highly recommend the chimichonga. Best one of my life (if you like cheese.)

Komex is a great restaurant with a nice and welcoming staff. If you love both Korean food and Mexican you can't go wrong with coming here. If you don't feel that adventurous have no fear Komex still offers more traditional Korean and Mexican dishes, which are still very good. The fusion is definitely the best part though! 

I highly recommend eating in, as they give you a basket of fresh homemade chips! Everything feels fresh and homemade. It's just a great place to eat, and you can tell your friends "Yeah, I had Komex for lunch."

This place is worth 10 stars!

I always take guests here from out of town because the korean mexican fusion concept is intriguing, yet so deliciously logical!

Food is simply amazing and the prices are so reasonable, especially for the large portions they serve!

This restaurant is hands down worth a trip if you are visiting from the Strip, and equally a hidden gem for locals looking to impress visitors!

I ordered the nachos with bulgogi, fusion enchilada and wontons.

Food-only ate here once but i love how they mix it up with korean and mexican dishes.  First timer and it was pretty good.  Nachos is awesome.

Ambiance-Felt good nice place to chillax and watch the game as well.

Customer service- on point! Super friendly and efficient.  Very helpful and patient.

Food 3 stars, customer sevice 5 stars.

This place f-ing sucks balls! As soon as you walk in this place it reeks of mildew dirty water!! The floor plan is horrible, the food server is forgetful and is overwhelmed with work. Whatever you do don't eat here I could've had a V8! I had the bulgoli cheesesteak with fries and it had no flavor whatsoever! Fuck this place!!!

My parents are usually very picky about trying new things. But I talked them into Komex knowing they usually like Mexican food and it worked out great. We ordered the tofu kimchi fried rice , chicken enchilada, veggie enchilada and a chicken torta. They end up liking the dishes so much they actually asked me to go back to get a menu because they're going to try ordering it on their own next time to try different things.

This place is simply clever. Taking the Korean world and fusing it together with the Mexican world, you get KoMex Fusion. Such a brilliant idea and the food does not disappoint the idea. My favorites is the Bulgolgi Nachos. It is very delicious and it gets me craving it just by talking about it. The best part about this restaurant is that the price is so reasonable and the portions are perfect. This is a very unique and delicious food experience!

This place lives up to the hype.  Reasonably priced Korean Mexican fusion.  The bulgogi enchiladas, Korean nachos, and Philly cheesesteak are great.  Service is good.  This is not a health food, arugula, anorexic chic restaurant.  This is a place for people who like food and are ok with the fact that eating involves calories.

This is my second trip. The first was with the family and this is a solo trip. The place is clean and the waitress is very friendly. I've tried an assortment of the tacos. All were very good. Saxby had the Korean style tater tot casserole. He loved it! The bulgogi bowl is great. Its basically bipmbap which i love. Today I'm having the bulgogi flautas. It's spicy Korean beef in fried rolled tacos. Delicious! Make sure you request the homemade salsas.
Service is great, server was very attentive. Food was delicious. Tried the pork belly and shrimp tacos. Definitely recommend them

Like others, I'm glad there is an outpost of Komex farther west.  As it's new, the restaurant is bright and airy and seems to seat more than the original location.  We arrived around 5pm on a Friday and was seated immediately.

We had our standard order of kimchi fried rice, calamari tacos, a trio of tostadas, and fusion nachos.  This was enough for four adults with healthy appetites. The deep fried rice patties for the base of the tostadas were especially good this time - crispy yet light and chewy.  Out of the three available meats - beef, chicken, pork - the chicken is the least inspiring.  

Service is always prompt and friendly.  Water glasses always filled.

By the time we left around 6:30, the place was filling up fast.  Plentiful parking and not in  a sketchy neighborhood.  We'll be back soon and often!

I have had few Korean Mexican mixes before, and I gotta say that they did a great job! 

We ordered Fusion burrito with beef and Fusion bulgogi fries with kimchi. They are both really delicious but that fries... it's a must. 

Service was wonderful, quick, and delightful. 

Overall, wonderful  place that's well deserving of your money.

My favorites here are the fish taco lettuce wraps, wings and bulgogi fries.  The fish tacos just taste so fresh and light.  The wings are fried crispy, juicy and tossed in slightly spicy kimchee sauce  The fries are piled high with cheese, pico and salsa and shredded bulgogi.  Service is always friendly and the latest time we went, the food came out really fast.  We could hear the wings drop into the fryer back in the kitchen.  This is a casual, low keyed neighborhood place with some really tasty food.
We enjoyed a new, yet familiar type of food.  The entr√©e portions generous, affordable and above all delicious.   We enjoyed the environment and will be back for more.

A friend recommended this place and I had to try it. There's taco trucks that are somewhat similar which I love so knew that I'd love this place. It's great that the tacos come with the option of a lettuce wrap. Had the bulgogi taco with lettuce wrap, pork belly taco with corn tortilla and the calamari taco with flour tortilla. All came with slaw. Kimchee was tasty too along with the chips, guacamole and salsa that was included. Hubby had the chimichanga which was huge!! He had to take half of it home. 
Would definitely go back. Have to try the taters, fries and won ton.  Would be interested in franchising this place for California. The website's link to franchise wasn't working. But, this place is a definite hit!

Whoa Whoa Whoa Whoa Whoa... Komex, where the heck have you been all my life? Ok, maybe it's a good thing you're 250+ miles away... or I'd need a triple bypass and a lifetime membership to the gym and Overeaters Anonymous. 

1/2 Nacho 1/2 Fries Combo. Talk about having your cake and eating it too. I couldn't decide between the Fushion Nachos or the Fusion Fries... but luckily this isn't a dilemma because I can order 1/2 of each. Komex, you're the real MVP!

Ok, seriously, who came this dish? According to my waistline, you are the devil. The nachos are the star. They're fresh outta the fryer - but not super oily at all (which is surprising.) The bulgogi, the cheese, the secret sauce... OMG. I'm drooling on my keyboard just thinking about it. Run 3 miles, come eat these nachos (and if you get the fries, request them WELL DONE), and then run another 13. It's worth it, trust me. 

Oh, I ordered some other stuff too - but who cares. Get the damn fusion nachos!

Actually really disappointed by this place. I've gone to the location on Decatur which is really good . I made a order for pick up they got my order wrong. Which I understand can happen but when we went back my BF order a burrito it was half open and looked like they half ass's my food point is .  If your mad you got the order wrong don't just half ass a service you have to fix !

Great service from our waitress!!  Attentive and patient as we have 3 children who were in their words "Starving!"  Food was great and my boys were very surprised with the flavors. My 3 year old daughter was less patient with the delivery of her French fries which she thinks should have apparently been waiting for her before we even entered this restaurant...  lol. She cracks me up. I loved the kimchi fried rice with egg as did my wife for the bacon fried rice. Quesadillas were ordered with chicken and cheese only.  VERY GOOD.  My youngest son dared to get the bulgogi grilled cheese with fries and was ready to say his food wasn't good...  until he sank his teeth into this incredible sandwich. Somehow the silence of his voice showed the appreciation of the food he was enjoying (well actually inhaling) (wasn't a pleasant sound he was creating but a laughable one!). 

Eat here and you'll be satisfied with your choice!  PROMISE.

Holy crap. It took me forever to decide what I wanted to get because I wanted to order e v e r y t h i n g.  They have tacos. Breakfast food. Burgers. Bulgogi everything. Spam musubi with fried egg?! The list goes on. The portions are pretty hefty. I came with a friend and we ordered 2 things each but it could have fed 4.  We had lots of left overs! (Which I ate the next day and it STILL was bomb!). The only downfall is that most of the dishes seem too greasy. I felt a little gross from all the oil but it was so worth it and I can't wait to go back!

Complimentary chips/salsa. Food is about 7-12$ each. This is a great spot for hangover food. Greasy, fatty, filling food. 

Beef kimchi fried rice- the kimchi flavor is very loud. Not too spicy.

Spicy pork chimichanga- the spicy pork flavor stood out the most. It was my favorite meat here. 

Tater tots- crispy and full of love.

Waitress was very attentive for lunch hour, and the food came out fast

The FLAVORS!!!!  Seriously, this place puts every other place out in the dog house).  I recommend the kimchi burrito or the Mexican style veggie burrito.  The salsas are great.  My only gripe is the attitude of the hostesses.  Sometimes they are amazing, sometimes not.  So... I take a star.  I've had the cronut.  Pretty good, though not amazing for the price.  The bulgogi fries are good, but the cheese sticks to the paper they line the Styrofoam with and you miss out on hella cheese (unless you like cheese paper like me, but it's no fun).

Honestly I've never had ANYTHING like this back home in Southern California  I had the fusion tater tots and it was super yummy and the bulgogi was really good too. My boyfriend had half and half fusion fries and nachos and those were really delicious as well. My hometown in Orange County really needs to step it's fusion game up!

Food-average.  My bff and i ate the tacos. Bulgogi, pork, chicken, and the calamari. The bulgogi was decent. The pork and chicken ehh. And the calamari honestly couldnt tell if it was calamari or fusion of a calamari and fish pate. The prices are great tho.  We also had the kimchi fried rice. It was extremely oily and honestly didnt taste the kimchi. It was more like rice with a spicy red sauce of mystery. Maybe ill give the N. Decatur one a try.  

As for customer service. I hate waving to the waiter for the check when theres only a few tables that were occupied.

I love this Korean Mexican fusion food. When you get here you have to get the bulgogi tater tots. I also get the bulgogi chimichanga!! So good!! Service is great and clean bathrooms. I would come back over and over again. I also got kimchi fried rice and is was bomb!!

Looks can be deceiving...don't judge a book by its cover...this place looks shady but the food was excellent!

The interior is very low key. I mean it's simply tables and chairs. It's clean and I like that! 

The service was very good. Our waitress was nice and knowledgable. She gave recommendations and I was pleased with the food. 

We ordered bulgogi nachos which were amazing. They had a Korean sauce that had a perfect kick to it. The meat was tender. This dish was on point. 

We also had the flautas which were fried just right. The guacamole to dip it in was great. We tried a pork belly fusion taco as well...eh. I've had better but it was tasty. 

The meal came with complementary chips and salsa. Chips were hot and fried! 

Will return to have the nachos but want to try the other location!

Update on my 2nd trip to Komex.......better than the first time if that's even possible.  Tried the  PBBBLT (Pork Belly, Bulgogi, Bacon, Lettuce and Tomato) sandwich this time and it was the heat!.  
They also had a special (that I pray becomes a regular) on the menu......Pork Belly skewers!  Talk about melt in your mouth goodness!  I could eat this stuff every day.  This is one of those kind of things that could be pulled into a dozen different other dishes.

Don't waste time.......go now!

Place is quiet by the time we went here, ( my kids and i ) their food was okay for the price we paid, service was good, there is only one girl working at that time and its already dinner time and they were starting to get busy, thats the only thing i have really noticed for a negative scenario that day. But all in all they're fine.

I'm so appalled that it took me this long to try this place but whew, finally! I love the concept, of course. The menu is not extremely extensive to the point where you get so confused on what to get. I opted for a simple Bulgogi & white rice because I was craving it but I also got to try their Bulgogi Chimichanga and Kimchi Fried Rice.

Nom! Everything was so tasty and unique. I really enjoyed my meal. Our server was extremely friendly as well. Tried to get the Fries to-go but she mentioned how it might be too soggy so she suggested the Nachos. Based on my cousins devouring it in minutes, I'd say the Nachos were delicious.

Can't wait to go back & try other dishes!

I kept hearing how this place was so great and what not, so I decided to give it a try finally. As soon as you sit down they bring over chips and salsa to your table. The salsa was tasty the only thing is I wish they would give a bigger portion of it to have sufficient for all the chips. But then again maybe that's just me I just love chips and salsa. I ended up going with the fusion tacos, I ordered one pork belly, one calamari, and one one shrimp taco to taste a little bit of everything as this was my first time here. The shrimp tacos were okay, the pork belly tacos were good I would order them again, and the calamari tacos were my favorite of all! They were so good I wished I had ordered all three of them as calamari! They also provide four different sauces for the tacos a salsa roja, a salsa verde, a Korean sauce that has sriracha in it I believe, and this sweet/spicy sauce which was my choice for my tacos. The sweetness of the sauce definitely topped off the flavors in my calamari taco. I also didn't expect the tacos to be as big as they were, it was difficult to finish the third one as they are not only big they were also stuffed quite a bit with the cole slaw and pico. I'm not a fan of corn tortillas so I substituted mine with flour tortillas. Tacos just taste better with flour tortillas in my opinion. All in all I am now a Komex fan and will definitely be back to try bulgogi next!

A pretty decent spot overall, IMO, this spot deserves about a 3.5 stars. I liked the food here, but wasn't completely sold on it for what it's worth.

This is a much bigger spot than the original location, and it also has a bar that you can sit down and order drinks, unlike the original location. After trying the food at both locations, I can say that for a fact that the food is exactly the same.

After sitting down, the server asked us for our drinks. I have to say, the service here is pretty good, even though they could have used more than one server. Our complimentary chips and dip then came out. So, I've never been a fan of flour tortilla chips, which is what they use here. But to each his/her own. The salsa was slightly better than the guac, but both were pretty weak. The guac could have used more acid and seasoning, and I wasn't big on the tomatoes they used for their salsa.

Fusion fries/nachos - I've tried both versions. In the end, it's just OK. The fries weren't as crispy as I would have liked, they became soggy rather quickly. Besides having the bulgogi, spicy pork bulgogi, and kimchi as toppings, the rest itself is pretty plain.. Something that you could get at any video poker bar.

On a brighter note, I had a bite of my friends' spicy pork quesadilla and it was good, except being just a tad too sweet. The portions here are great considering the value.

For the fusion part, they take Korean ingredients and incorporate them into Mexican dishes. This is just my opinion, but I would like to see it the other way around as well. For example, they can make a carne asada/al pastor/ or carnitas fried rice or chow fun. It's just a thought. It's their business and they can run it as they deem fit. They seem pretty successful with their own formula, but I think that would be pretty cool to see, even just as a special. 

I thought the food was ok here. Some of my friends are fanatics about this place, and I wouldn't mind tagging along with them if they were in the mood. But, I can't see myself stopping in by my own accord.

YELP! WHY WONT YOU LET ME DO MORE THAN FIVE STARS?! This place is amazing! I can't believe I had never heard of it until today. Korean and Mexican fusion is literally the best combo and there just aren't enough spots around town. This place is top notch. Service was great, and food was absolutely DELICIOUS. I have to go back and try everything on the menu. Their bulgogi is perfectly marinated and tender. Food comes out fast and leaves you feeling too full to move. I definitely have a new fav in town..
BOMB BOMB BOMB!  KoMex Fusion nacho fries are amazing!  Also had the enchiladas, SUPER!  This is one of my favorite spots to eat, GREAT food, service and very affordable!  You have to try it!!!

Great food & Great Service! I found this place from Yelp over a year ago when I wanted something different but close distance to where I was. I love the fusion menu. This style of food is not something I was used to or ever had before.. but I'm happy I tried it... now this place is a family fav... we eat from here regularly.

Wowooo they mix Koren and Mexican cuisine and let me tell I never tested food so bad.i ordered chicken chow mein- the easiest dish to make and even on cheap Chinese restaurant it taste good! 
But this is was horrible !!!! Taste like they made it 5 days ago and keep reheated that. The chicken was full of unknown bones/fat/ cartilage! 
AVOID THIS PLACE EVEN IF ITS $6 for a dish!!!!!!!!!

This place is so DANG GOOD!!!
One of the main things I love about this place is that they're consistent in the flavor.  
If you go, TRY THE BEEF!!! Take my word for it.

Great customer service. Quick and professional. My sister ordered the Kimchi chicken fried rice. Delicious. I ordered the enchilada plate with the choice of bulgogi. I know it wasn't the best choice. The food here is great tho. Korean mix with Mexican food. Unique food. A place to definitely try. All you need is 5 on ittt

Oh my gosh. I first tried this for an event held at UNLV and the food is so delicious. My favorite were the flautas and the spicy sauce that comes with it. Korean/ Mexican food is so good and I will be back to this location to try more of their food.

One of the best restaurants in Vegas. I've been a customer since their other location on Decatur. It's great to see a local family run restaurant and see the changes and improvements they've been implementing over the years.

I love their bulgogi fusion nachos with kimchi on top. The chimichanga is awesome too. The staff is great and the owner is always very polite and attentive. The prices are very good too. We walked out with a check for $22 for three people. Not many places in Vegas where you can get food from a local family for that price and for great service.

I highly recommend ordering from the fusion menu, asking for kimchi on top of whatever you get, and asking for the hot sauce that they bring out on the side (ask for it when they serve your food).

I'm always up to try new food especially any fusion restaurants. I had the fusion burrito with spicy pork and the pork belly fries. They also gave complimentary tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole. I don't know what it was about the guacamole, but I couldn't get enough if it.

As for my fusion burrito, it tasted unique and great. The portion size was huge for what it was worth. For the fries, I got the half order for $6 and replaced bulgogi with pork belly for $2. The fries were cheesy with the right amount of spice, but I wish they gave more pork belly. I suggest getting the full order for $8 and just keeping the bulgogi.

This place is definitely worth a try though and the service is great.

Solid place to grub. Service was great. They had Mexican pepsi on the menu but our server said it was not available at this location yet but should be soon. They did have Mexican coke so I had that. The real deal pepsi has me curious still so I will need to come back. 

Our visit started with free chips, guacamole, and salsa. I do not eat the green stuff so that went to the wife who liked it. I did think the salsa had a good taste. 

The chicken flautas here are very good yo! I am not much of a chicken fan but man these are good. Fried wontons were cheap and good. I don't remember what was in them, some type of meat but they were good. The main dish I wanted to try was the Beef Chow Fettuccine. It was a damn big portion and tasted great. The fusion tacos were okay but not my cup if regular tea. Priced here are reasonable. 

When the bill came I was surprised at how cheap it was for all the food we had. I also got a fortune cookie that had 2 cookies in it! Does this mean I am going to get extra lucky? I will be lucky enough to eat here again because I liked it.

The concept sounded exciting, but I found the food to be too much (I know, I know. . . most Americans would call me crazy for even saying that!), and the flavor lacking from what I expected based on the reviews.  It's kind of like a Chipotle with some Korean sauce.  The Nachos sunk to the bottom of my stomach and stayed there for quite a while (too much oil in the chips).  As with Chipotle, the burrito had waaayyyy too much rice.  Will not be a repeat customer.

At last they are our neighborhood! We got the kimchee fried rice with combo meat. They do an egg on top.  It was excellent.  We also got the chow fettuccine with chicken. I like it a little spicy. They have amazing sauc es. The sweet - spicy Korean is my favorite. Although we picked up the order to go it was just as good as if we dined in. That says a lot in itself! Great food and as always friendly service.
Love this place! Bulgolgi Tator Tots are absolutely amazing, like nothing I've tasted! I love the Korean/Mexican flare.

This was our second time enjoying KoMex when we visited Vegas. It's off the strip but well worth the drive. The food is fresh with tons of flavor. The service is great and the staff is friendly. We tried lots of different things on the menu and took to go boxes back to our room. Everything tasted great, there wasn't one dish that we didn't enjoy.
This place is amazing so delicious and affordable. 2 dollar street tacos are incredible and the sweet spicy sauce.. Has me wanting to go back for more !!!
Interesting fusion food.  The family was satisfied.  Big food portions.  Very clean and friendly service.

If you've never tried fusion food, this is a great intro :) 
I'm a little bias since I'll pretty much order the same thing whenever I do visit this place and that's the bulgogi burrito. You definitely get your money's worth for how much food they give you and if you dine in, they give you chips & salsa. 
Just a heads up, bulgogi is sweet so if you're not prepared for a "sweeter" burrito, try something else. They have a couple different sauces to choose from and my favorite was the KoMex sauce. Didn't really try to figure out what it was made of, but you can never go wrong with house sauce. 
The place itself isn't too busy, last time everyone ordered for pickup so had the place to myself. 
They have two different locations if this one isn't closer to you, but the other location has a smaller parking lot. 
Don't eat here too often, but it's good !
Pretty interesting fusion of Korean and Mexican cuisines. Be prepared to be intrigued. Excellent food and service. Drinks are delivered in bottles or jars.

I'm not much of a Mexican food person but I do enjoy it once in awhile. Plus I love Korean food too so this place hits the spot when I'm craving something like a burrito.

Comparing both locations , I like this location over the one on Decatur/north Las Vegas since it's much more spacious and they're more generous on the meat.

The food portion is very filling for it's price. My boyfriend and I ordered the beef bulgogi burrito w/ kimchi to share and a half order of their pork bulgogi fries for about 15$. We were only able to finish the burrito & had to take the fries to go bc it was too much ! Half portion of fries is huge and can be split among even more than two people. They also have ghost pepper sauce here which I prefer than tabasco sauce.

Complimentary chips, salsa & guac w/ your order and complimentary oranges at the end. Orders didn't take that long to come out. Service was very fast and efficient which I liked.

I had high expectations after hearing so much about this place. It was ok. Everything tastes the same. A lot of items with bulgogi. I would like to have seen more variety. Pork belly tacos were nothing special; nachos were ok, order the small - large is huge and eating too much of it is a little overwhelming. I was expecting more.

Was a little skeptical at first with the whole Korean Mexican mixture, I'm super happy that I stopped here to eat. The food was delicious, the service was great and the location was well maintained. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area wanting to try something new

Food was satisfying and not overloading, felt nourished after eating 3 tacos. I liked the Korean and MX fusion, would definitely eat there again, this place is a new favorite.
Wait staff was friendly and attentive. Fair prices.

Wow. Walking into this place, I did not expect to be as blown away as I was. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing wrong with this place at all. It's very clean, quiet, and actually decent size, but the inside isn't that interesting. But honestly, with the food as good as it was I couldn't care less about the decor. We started with the complimentary chips and salsa- which I'm a sucker for. The salsa was yummy and the chips were made in house- I think. Next came the fried wontons. HOLYYYYY MOTHER OF PEARL! I could have eaten a couple orders of those and been good to go! The flavor was absolutely delicious. They were perfectly crisp, and the meaty inside was just so juicy and flavorful. Next came the fusion tacos which we got lettuce wrapped and wow. The meat was tender, the slaw was a great crunch and the pico was perfect. All the flavors married together for a perfect little food wedding in your mouth. Next up was the Nachos. YUM. The chips were crunchy. Meat was tender. Sauce was saucy. Cheese was melty. It was all just sooooo good. I was more than pleasantly surprised with this place. The hostess/waitress was super nice too. Honestly, if you haven't yet, do yourself a favor and give this place a try. I can't wait to go back and get some of those fried wontons and try some other treats off the menu!
Food was good! Thanks for the recommendation Jose :)

Was a great place to get our kimchi rice fix(: 
Bulgolgi burrito: amazing! Refreshing as well
Kimchi fried rice: superb! I highlly recommend you ggetting it

There are two locations. The other location is closed on Sunday! Complimentary nachos with guacamole and salsa. 

We tried the fusion nachos and the fusion burrito. The fusion nachos were surprisingly good! The bulgogi is tender and tasty. There's also salsa and jalape√±os on the nachos.

I wasn't that impressed with the fusion burrito. I wasn't into the salad part of the burrito. The bulgogi and rice and salsa and the veggie flavors didn't really jive well together. 

Service is good though! Waitress and waiter both very friendly.

I honestly don't know how people eat here. These people leaving nice comments must be friends or families member of the owners. My husband and I ordered take out. When we first walked in it smelled like old rotten food like they don't refrigerate their food. Once we got home and opened the food it smelled the same way. My husband got the kimchi fried rice and as soon as he took a bit he spit it out. I can't believe these people make a living off of this shit. I'm usually not the one to be picky but my gosh this place is the worst. I thought I should give you guys a heads up before you order from here. If you don't believe me just walk into the place and see how it smells.

I love this place!!! This is the only place that sells Korean food mixed with Mexican food and I love that. I always order the kimchi fried rice with spam OMG it's so good. And you're able to order spam musubi here with an egg in it and it honestly tastes better with the egg. 
Service is 3/5 lady is nice and served us not right away but she eventually served us it just takes a while for food to cook so it'll be a bit waiting too 
Pricing isn't too bad it's affordable and worth the amount of food you get. 
They also allow for pick up too so if you just wanna pick up your food to eat at home you can or you can dine in (btw this place isn't fast food)
The inside was big, spacious lots of places to sit and there's a tv so you can watch the game yay! lol overall I feel this place deserves a 4 star. 
Back to food I also ordered a bulgogi fries and it was pretty different just because they changed the meat to bulgogi it actually made the fries a little more sweet but that made it taste better because it's a combo of spicy and sweet? Idk but yeah this place is worth a try I'd recommend
Always awesome to eat here. I highly suggest trying the calamari fashion tacos! You won't be disappointed!

Don't understand the rave reviews at least not for the fusion fish tacos. They are pretty bland with no pop for a place that has Mexico and Korean flavors. Anyway the toppings were fresh which is good and their salsas were good too.  I just expected more taste in the fish and batter.  Waitress was friendly and I appreciate that.

Been here twice now. Love the nachos and the chimichanga. Great Tex mex style food with a Korean kick. If I had one complain I wish they had a soda machine with refills.  But even without that I had a blast.

Tacodilla is so good that it may be the best thing that I'll eat on this Vegas vacation.  It's a specials menu item that is so delicious that I'd love to convince the owners to open a KoMex in Phoenix where I live.

Komex is a must when we go to Vegas.  We have been to the other location a few times and decided to try this location on a Sunday. (This one is closed on Monday, the other is closed on Sunday).

We shared a 1/2 order of beef nachos and 1/2 order of pork fried rice.  The 10-year ordered the calamari tacos.

The nachos were my favorite, I think I prefer their beef over the pork.  Huge portions and these were just the 1/2 orders.

This location is a bit further out from the strip, but its roomier, newer, and cooler (literally, like better air conditioned) than the first location.

This location is way less busy than the original and the food is just as amazing. I love anything with pork belly and Komex has great pork belly (not just the fatty garbage that other places call pork belly). 

I strongly recommend the kimchi fries rice, it's very unique and unlike anything you've had before.

Wow. Great food great servers. I went with my family. My son had fusion flautas and they tasted great. The salsa which seemed to have a bit of avocado tasted great with them. My wife had the wings. Those wings don't need ranch or blue cheese. We took a friend for his birthday and he had a bulgogi bowl. It look very very appealing and made me want to change. The Kim Chi fried rice was a plate I ordered for the table and we all enjoyed it immensely. I'll be back without a doubt.

I've never ordered anything from here that disappointed me. My boyfriend is obsessed with their fried rice and usually orders a chicken/pork combo. I love their veggie tacos, kimchi fried rice, and tofu fried rice. They really know how to infuse both Mexican and Korean flavors and make it so delicious. Their kimchi fried rice is so damn good. It has a good spice level with a generous portion of kimchi and is topped with a fried egg. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I'm so glad this place is nearby because there are days I don't wanna go out to eat and I'd rather have take out so I can be fat and lazy at home lol.

What do you get when you mate the land of Starcraft with the country of donkey shows?  You get KoMex.  Don't let this Korean and Mexican fused restaurant fool you with its weird fusion of ingredients.  KoMex will make you fall in love with it and will make you put a ring on it.

We arrived about a half hour when it opened and there were people sitting at tables.  Fortunately, we were able to get a table for 6 with the quickness.  We sat down and admired the paintings on the wall:  people with the mixture of Korean and Mexican features.  Oh, it didn't stop at the paintings, it was also on the menu.  

We opened up the menu and explored it....hard.  Damn, everything sounded good.  Burritos, tacos, fries, rice platters, you name it they got it.  We decided we were going to order about 2-3 plates each because everyone on Yelp were saying this place was awesome.  

The waitress was super cool-- big smile on her face, cracked jokes with us, made fun of us, and overall, made us feel like family.  As she wrote down our orders I know she was thinking to herself ," Man, these guys are high."  Haha......maybe...just kidding.  Crack is whack!  D.A.R.E.!

I ordered 2 fusion steak tacos, 1 pork belly fusion taco, a half plate of fried rice, and a half plate of fusion fries.  I'm a big boy, and I need big boy food.  Let me say this-- when I got my food, the half portions looked like full meals.  Geez....I wouldn't have been surprised if my heart gave out on me that day.  

The fusion tacos were delicious, especially the pork belly.  So fatty, greasy, flavorful, but enough about me, let's talk about the fried rice.  The fried rice was something your parents made at home.  Sike.  This fried rice was way better than what your parents made.  The rice actually didn't taste stale!  I swear, most fried rice dishes you can taste the staleness of it.  But this rice, this rice was soft and delicious.  Oh, don't let me get started on the fries.  DON'T LET ME GET STARTED.  Do I really have to say something about them?  Ok.  Fries good, communism bad.

By the way, this place gave us a free full plate of pork nachos.  I don't care if they dropped it on the floor.  Shoot, if it did fall on the floor, the floor tasted just as good as the food.

KoMex, will you marry me?  Seriously, everyone must try this place out.  Let me say this-- it's wayyyyy better than Arby's.

Great food, amazing price, the most friendly staff! Love the new location withy the option to get some ice cold beer. 

The owners couldn't be nicer and their food is always fresh and delicious! My favorite spot in Vegas for a quick, cheap, and yummy meal!

Komex is such a great spot to get some Korean / Mexican fusion food.  I tried three different tacos ( Korean fusion beef spicy taco, fish fusion taco and the Mexican asada steak taco) . The food was delicious and the service was prompt. I have a feeling I will go there often.
The food was average for me and my husband. He had the bulgogi plate and I had the spicy pork plate. It was just ok, the rice was a little dry and the meat was just ok.
Picked up a Vegas weekly mag and it highlighted this place for its Nachos. Next day I checked it out for myself. Bulgogi nachos/fries are legit...can't go wrong.

Seriously love this place!! My co-workers and I eat here about at least twice a week. We work close by so this is our to go place! Linda is amazing and friendly! Highly recommend their pork bulgogi lettuce wrap and pork bbq skewer!! I would eat here every day if I could
This restaurant is quite terrible to its taste in atmosphere and I will never return to this place and general.

Ordered the Bulgogi rice and the carne asada burrito. Super pissed because the rice was not as described.  See the phot of the menu-when I called the gal said the sunny side up egg was at an additional cost.  I called ahead and she had described the entrees, but there was a language barrier. When I called back to tell her that it wasn't explained as it was on the menu, she was rude and condescending, so I didn't appreciate that either. I was a bit apprehensive to try this place because it was so empty at lunch and the food took so long.  I called ahead too.  
The carne asada burrito had beans like-pork and beans and it was mushy and tasted sweet. 
I think fusion for some foods are great but the fact is, some things shouldn't happen. This place is that.

Always awesome, comfort food at its best. Warm reception and great service. If you can't find anything on the menu you must be dead. Great prices and tons of great tasting food we grew up eating. One of the many hidden treasures in town.

The Skinny: tried their beef, chicken, pork belly, fish taco - would only recommend getting 1 out of 4 (3) Service: good and prompt (3) Value: given we'd only order 1 dish out of four again, I think we'll pass on this (3).

I'd been wanting to try this place out for a while given everything that I've read and heard about this place. Finally, they opened a location close by my hood? Game on.

So we ordered their beef, chicken, pork belly and fish fusion tacos to start.

We were served up the complimentary chips, salsa and guacamole which was decidedly meh. I forgot to take a picture of the guacamole but it was brown and relatively bland. The salsa was alright but nothing special. The chips were clearly their homestyle fried corn tortillas which were overly thick and greasy.

The fusion tacos we ordered were quite filling and the serving size is quite large. All the tacos were topped with shredded cabbage and tomatoes (FYI, I thought the tomatoes rather flavorless pale beefsteak tomatoes - not a of which I was not a fan.) There was a little too little meat per veggie ratio in the taco for my tastes.

The fish in the fish tacos had a really tough coating on it and missing a nice light sauce on top to tie everything together. I found it overall to be too dry.

The pork belly and the chicken tacos were okay - both had a hit of smokiness however they were oddly underseasoned for Korean food. I expected big flavor hits of chili paste and sesame oils... which weren't there.

The best thing we tried was the bulgogi taco which was good - it was seasoned right and had a good amount of grilled flavor to it.

Overall, given that we only really thought 1 dish was good out of 4, I think we'll pass on this place even though we were glad to finally check out what all the fuss was about (3 starred review).

Love this place!! The food is always delicious. You get some chips, salsa, and guacamole for free to munch on while you wait for the food to come out. The food comes out so quick, it's awesome. The service is always excellent. No matter how busy the place is the service never seems to fall short, especially since there are only 1-2 servers. 

I always order the fusion burrito with beef and kimchi, mouthwatering deliciousness! I think the main star are the pork belly's on a stick. I promise you will not regret it if you order this. Who doesn't like pork belly?! 

We will definitely be coming back to this place.

Went here on a whim - was looking for somewhere to eat and found this place on Yelp.  Korean and Mexican are two food types I'd never have imagined worked well together, but they do!  Would definitely recommend the pork belly fusion fries (something like that - not the nachos, but the french fry nachos with pork belly.)  We got the fries/nachos combination and the fry side just seemed to work/taste better (also, FYI, this combination is HUGE - great for sharing!).  I'd also recommend the calamari fusion tacos - again, wasn't sure what to expect, and it blew my mind!  Prices are reasonable, service is a little slow so not really good if you're on a time limit, but definitely worth checking out.

Sorry, but I just don't get it. Yes, it is fusion but it maybe my taste buds or the things are made. 

Walked into the door, and yes, the service was exceptional. Greeted right away and sat right down. 

Ordered their tacos: beef, chicken and pork belly; & nachos with spicy pork. I have to admit, it's kinda weird because I'm used to eating Korean food -- Korean way not mixed with Mexican.

I do have to admint that the pork belly is worth getting. 

One more thing, this place has an odd smell. Maybe it's their cleaning supplies? Just cleaned the area where I sat?
Love the bulgogi fries I am addicted!  Also the tacos and the flautas are really good too!  Great mix of both types of foods.
Another great visit.  They food is always fresh and good.  I do prefer the other location but no biggy.  Nice staff.

Boom! This place is quite the discovery. So I had it bookmarked for awhile and I am really glad I finally got to try it. We arrived right before the lunch rush and when I say rush the place was packed when we left. No real motif to the place, more just like a local bar/restaurant with simple tables and no hostess. I love these types of places! We were greeted as we walked in and seated right away. 

So the food is a mix of Mexican and Korean, two foods I really do enjoy so I was excited. We tried the dak bulgogi tacos with lettuce, the bulgogi bowl with fried eggs, spam masubi and the pork belly masubi with a fried egg. All of it.....amazing! 

The masubis were a large portion and a definite reason to go back. Definitely recommend this delicious spot!

I heard about this place and wanted to try it out. 
Pineapple soju was great!!!! The chips n salsa with Guac is decent. Food was mediocre we ordered fusion tacos chix, bulgogi& spicy pork (these were my fav) kimchi bugulgi burrito ( this was so-so not that flavorful the meat tastes like its left soaking in sauce prior to serving it) pork belly masubi with egg added ( my husbands liked it. It had no flavor at all it was very bland )  bugulgi fries with fries extra crispy this was meh..... There were 3 of us and we all agreed we won't be craving this or care to come back for this food. What a bummer

Ko-mex definitely lived up to its expectations. The fusion tacos in the fusion tostada was definitely satisfying. We also shared that half-and-half nacho fries with the fusion beef as well definitely coming. Our service was very good waitress everyone was very friendly

The original KoMex location is one of my favourite places to go in the city for delicious eats and friendly service.  This new location is larger and shinier than the original and boasts a bar!  (No drink menu yet though.)  There was even a large, flat-screen TV in the bar area, conveniently situated for those wanting to watch the current sports game whilst enjoying KoMex's fusion delights.  I DID find it odd that there was a large empty space in front of the entrance.  Perhaps the restaurant's order for more tables and chairs was exceptionally tardy?

I'm glad to report that the food is still as yummy as found at the original KoMex.  Service is still friendly, but my server must have been new, because she was on the slow side in responding to requests (we wanted condiments and utensils!).   We still received our free chips/salsa/guacamole and the dessert orange and prices, while slightly higher than in early 2013, are still very reasonable.

All in all, I'm glad there is a second location on the west side, as that is evidence that the owners are doing well!
I love this place. I go to it whenever I want to get something to snack on. I really like how affordable they are and have great quality food.

I have been meaning too come check out KoMex for awhile now. Or could say all the times been too babystack cafe located in the same shopping plaza keep thinking too myself need too try KoMex the next day. Well I finally got around too it.  

It was a mixed experience or really one not very star any worthy dish and then one that was home run. I came for lunch. The house chips and salsa/guacamole talk about great start too any meal of the day. The salsa was really nice not too spicy but still had a nice little kick too it. The guacamole was awesome! The chips was crispy, hot, and really could tell fresh tortilla they fried off. The seasoning on the chips was spot on too. Just make sure not too overload on them. Or just cave in too the addiction that once get one need another and another...

I ordered two dishes the fusion sliders and the kim chee fried rice. The fusion slider for me not fan of at all. The bulgogi meat that was awesome had really nice flavor, moist, and could have had whole plate just the meat. I felt like  it failed especially came too the slider buns. It was little bigger then normal slider buns. I felt with every bite was eating more bread then the whole compliment of bulgogi and the topping too the hot sauce inside the slider. The bun by itself was very bland and sandwich not sandwich if your bread all out of whack too start. Where the fusion sliders not the best thing on the menu. Once I got too try the kim chee fried rice with spam and topped with fried egg. Back in my Happy place with food. The spam goes really well with the kim chee make nice balance of flavors and fried egg on anything easy sold on that idea. I love me some fried egg. 

The portion sizes are decent size as are the prices. Most of the entrees all under $10 or not many that recall that went over that amount. The service was great, friendly, suggested spam with my fried rice (I was going in different direction but always trust the servers recommendation?), and very attentive making sure everything was ok. 

Although it was hit and miss. KoMex definitely place come back too try more of the menu. Not only reasonable price, good food, and even better close too the house!!
Yummy food but the service is just okay. I had to wait a long time for water but it was worth it for the delicious bulgogi tacos

I decided to try this place after a recommendation from a friend. I ordered a beef fusion burrito (no pico). First of all, the burrito was HUGE! All ingredients tasted very fresh. It was delicious. I can't wait to come back and try something else. Highly recommended. I will definitely be back soon.

I strongly recommend the bulgogi tacos and bulgogi burrito. The meat is perfectly marinated and the fusion style blends everything with perfection. And the house blend hot sauce (there are Kim chi bits in it) is a must-try - not too hot but very flavorful. They even give you an orange as dessert! Great price point, amazing service, basically this place is flawless.

Easy to get to location, great tasting food and very friendly service.   I ordered the Bulgagi plate with rice and Korean wings.   Definitely a great place to go.   Saw the Fusion Burrito delivered to a table and WOW, great.  They also have a Happy Hour from 3 - 6 pm for beer/wine.  Will have to check that out!!

Korean food and Mexican food?! The Fusion bulgogi burrito is awesome! You got to try the Fusion philly bulgogi because your taste buds will thank you later! Always a great experience when coming in here with great food and wonderful customer service!

Wow! I'd been hearing about this place for years, but only recently got to try it. The food was delicious!  I could eat it everyday! 
I had a couple tacos and a buogogi bowl, my fianc√© had a toastada and some soju.
Everything was so flavorful and decently priced. Definitely going to be a regular stop now.
Great place with a very interesting fusion! I love Korean and Mexican food and this place nails that fusion. A must place to try if you are interested in something different.

Great local eatery. Close to home. Korean-Mexican fuse dishes. Very clever, you get best of both worlds in one bite. Service was great & the staff was very friendly. The waitress was attentive to everyone dining there. Two thumbs for service!! The food was amazing. Complimentary chips and salsa while you wait for your food. They also give you half an orange after your meal. The food was amazing, we ordered the bulgogi tater tots, bulgogi rice bowl & carne asada burrito. We killed it, licked the plate clean and the bill came out to about 28$. Highly recommended. I'll take my friends from out of town here for lunch/dinner.

Based on Yelp reviews and pictures we couldn't wait to check this place out! I love Asian fusion type restaurants since there are so many choices to eat that are pretty unique. We got there and sat down promptly. Our waitress was super nice and gave us suggestions and explanations for some menu items :) 
I settled on getting the bulgogi fried rice and the pork belly musubi with fried egg (which cost extra for some reason?). My husband got the bulgogi cheese steak sandwich and my friend got the teriyaki chicken with rice.
My friend rice was so so good! The half portion is huge for being half and the bulgogi had good flavors. My husband's sandwich was the winner though. The bulgogi was marinated really well and the cheese and meat combo was fantastic. The pork belly I was alittle disappointed with. It was a bit dry and wasn't seasoned as well as the other items. Over the pork belly musubi was okay (need a sauce or something). My friend liked her chicken teriyaki as well. Overall it was a pleasant experience with good food for a good price ! If we are ever back in town we will def. Come back here :)
I got food to go and had a DELICIOUS bibimbop bowl! Portions are big and the price is just right. Enjoy!

Have eaten at the original location at least a dozen times, but never tried the shrimp fusion taco - until today. The shrimp quality is amazing, almost lobster-like & not 'watery' like cocktail shrimp. 

My favorite house salsa is the bright red one with green onions in it. Perfect medium-hot heat. I put at least 1 ounce of it on each taco.

Reasonably-priced, and incredibly nice service. Not exactly a great date spot or a place to impress your in-laws - just creative, quality food served up with love. Nothing wrong with that!

After reading so many positive reviews from Yelp we have decided to give it a try for lunch today. Honestly speaking, I am disappointed by the experience.

Most of the reviews I have read are talking about the taste of the food is so good with a very cheap price. I guess since I did not order the taco, I've become the exception. What I had was a Bulgogi plate, which is basically half white rice with half ground beef. The portion is decent, I think I would be full if I could finish it. However, the taste of the beef is dry and salty, it might work when you put them into a taco, but not on the white rice, this is simply wrong. I wish they at least put some cooked onion to blend in a little bit of sweetness, but there was none. The full size Bulgogi plate is $9.

I hope when a restaurant put some items like Bulgogi plate on their menu, they really meant for it.

New KoMex location. Same very delicious KoMex food. 

If you haven't tried KoMex yet get down to this location or the original location ASAP. I hated the long almost 1 hr waits at the other location on some days. Yes it's that good. So I'm very happy this one finally opened up. Korean Mexican fusion is an excellent combination. I ordered their Fusion Burrito, my usual order, and inhaled that sucker like I was in a pie eating contest. Why waste time eating 1 yummy thing when I could eat 2 yummy things, didn't do 2 but wanted to. The one thing that you must do is add lots and lots of their hot sauces on anything you get it's a big difference maker but in moderations. I almost ate all 4 of the containers of sauce on my own. It's very good. They should bottle them cause I might want to take some home.

Their fusion tacos, burritos, nachos, fries, etc are served with various meats like spicy pork, pork belly, chicken, and more all come with a Korean/Mexican twist. Even their cheese steak was different, using bulgogi. Check out the pictures and reviews at the original location it will pretty much tell you wassup.

I enjoyed the customer service friendly, complementary chips, salsa, guacamole, fortune cookies, and oranges to end the meal. They were still finishing up construction and decorating, fine tuning things like only cash at the time, 1 out of the 6 menu books at our table was without a menu inside, and temp banner outside but things are looking good. Seems like more space for more seats and even a bar area. I'll probably be back before the weeks over. No I will definitely be back before the weeks over.

Located in the same plaza as BabyStacks Cafe and Hikari SW Buffalo and Flamingo.

Did I mention that they're pretty cheap in price.

Ordered to go, got the fried rice and beef and pork belly skewers. 

And maybe I ordered the wrong thing but the fried rice was very bland. The skewers we okay.

Just not very flavorful. It was a miss for me.

Not busy at all when I came in last weekend for lunch. Unlike the other location there is:
* A place to park.
* No wait.
* Nice, knowledgeable wait staff.
* Fast service.
Expect the same, great food that you want to tell the whole world about. Personally I enjoy:
* Fusion Tostada- Bulgogi, pico de gallo, and lettuce on top a delicious crunchy rice patty. Think the bottom of your rice cooker, but tastier!
* Fusion Nachos- Get the half order and you'll still have more than enough. So much cheese! As with anything else, load up on hot sauce. It's sweet and hot!
* Bulgogi Cheesesteak- It's like a cheesesteak but with bulgogi beef. Also the cheese isn't all oozy and slimy.
* Fusion Flautas- I have to have at least one. Something crazy happens when they mix cheese and bulgogi beef. It will change you!
You will order too much food. Take it home and eat the soggy leftovers. Also, your burps will stink like yummy.

Having previously been a big fan of the KoMex location on Decatur, I met up here with a few friends for dinner.

For starters, this location is a lot larger and more comfortable. The servers are attentive and nice. I ordered the beef enchiladas.

To be honest, I was a bit disappointed. The enchilada came out a bit cold, the Korean-style beef wasn't evenly distributed within the enchilada, and parts of the rice tasted a little dry and overlooked. It might have been the dish, or the fact that we were a large group, but I wasn't a huge fan and wouldn't eat that dish again.

As a note for large groups: I appreciated that they split the bill for our table without issue, left us with a pitcher of water, and gave us (like at the old location) delicious orange slices, with plenty extra for the whole group, to munch on afterwards.
Amazing place to eat! Food is amazing, service is wonderful, the nachos, tortas, and pork belly tacos were all amazing.

Love love Korean Mexican fusion!  Bulgogi fries, kimchi fried rice, pork belly tacos and nachos were so delicious!  A must try and once you try it, you'll be hooked!  Amazing flavors, mixture of korean meat and mexican dish combined!
So yummy. I love the fusion nachos with kimchi

We came here per a recommendation from our friends who are locals. Great concept but we have had better in San Diego. 

Bulgogi Tacos - The meat is very well marinated but other than that, the taco was stuffed with more veggies than meat. 

Bulgogi Chicken Tacos - This was just okay. There were pieces that were chewy and pretty sure I had a bone. 

Bulgogi Burrito - Same as the taco but filled with rice. This was huge! But nothing spectacular. The rice was mushy. 

One thing I noticed about this place was their tortillas didn't have that tortilla texture. It is more mealy. Not a fan of that. 

Best thing about this restaurant would be the two slices of watermelon at the end and the fortune cookies.

1st time trying komex food..  And I have to say..  It's good! I love both xD and so happy this is rite by my place now. I will be there all the time know I hope this place stays..  Cuz in that spot has been like 2 restaurants that came and gone..

From the second we walked in the door to the time the check was paid, the customer service was excellent. We were immediately greeted with a cheerful hello and the waitress, Liz, promptly arrived to deliver the menus and take the drink order. She came back with drinks and a basket of complimentary house made chips with salsa and guac. 

I said that we were first timers so she helped us make some selections and recommended we give the fusion tacos a go, and we did. We sampled shrimp fusion tacos, fusion flautas with dak-bulgogi (chicken), stir fried kimchi, fried wontons and veggie chow fettuccine. Everything we tried was ok but I was a little disappointed with the spicy level. I was expecting HOT and I got mild at best. But it's nothing a little hot sauce won't cure. Also, I'd probably order the kimchi fried rice (Liz said it was really good) instead of the stir fry in the future. 

For the price, the portions are large. It's a decent spot to grab some quick, cheap lunch and I can't imagine I won't give it another go. I want to give some of the other items a try. I've got my eye on those nachos everybody is raving about.

The other location was closed this weekend so we came here instead..
Very spacious restaurant with tables, chairs, and bamboo sticks.

shared bulgogi nachos, which was good..loaded with melty cheese.
fish taco came in flour tortilla with lettuce.  no white sauce on top but plenty of salsa on the table to add to.  loved the kimchi salsa they had.  very spicy but very tasty and addictive.
bulgogi cheesesteak was loaded with meat, cheese, and onions.

besides fusion stuff, they have the traditional mexican foods.  everything was lacking in flavor, but thanks to the salsa, it livened it up a bit...

San Pedro was blessed to have this deliciously amazing eatery from Las Vegas in a 2 day pop up event at Ports'o'call. We are hooked on the chicken bulgogi tacos with lettuce, shredded veggies, and a killer hot sauce. Our senses were left in a state of arousal only teen boys at the girls camp would know. All perfect. All delectable. All wonderful.

Always amazing food here. I lived in Korea for a year and a half and love good Korean food. I love good Korean fusion food too and Komex does it better than almost anybody. All food is very well priced and ginormously flavorful. Burritos are huge, tacos are fantastic and the nachos and fries are humongous portions. You can get Korean style beef, chicken or pork. Authentic flavors in all. There's also a great variety of hot sauces to put on everything. I strongly recommend getting kimchi added to your order for a little more kick.

Came here on a Friday morning - we literally sat outside waiting for 11 am to hit so we could run inside. We intentionally came to this location so we can see how the new Komex is doing before heading out of town. 

What I'm happy to see is how much bigger the seating area of this Komex is. I always felt a little claustrophobic in the main one. There are still complimentary chips w/ salsa & guac, and the cute orange at the end of your meal. These are both awesome, and I hope they stay forever. 

The real testament was the Chicken Bulgogi Enchiladas ($7.50) - they were as fantastic, if not even better (!) than I've always remembered. :-) Big pieces of perfectly grilled dark meat, a ton of gooey cheese, and the mild sauce that lets me jazz it up with the 4 sauces they put on each table. The service is still friendly and awesome. 

Really wish we had Komex out in CA, I'd probably eat there everyday. Keep expanding, please! :-)

Oh man, this place is the best!  Stopped here with the family on the way back from CA to Denver. I can't even begin to describe how great the flavor is on the pork belly and bulgogi tacos. My wife got the bulgogi nachos and they were also out of this world. While they have straight Korean and Mexican dishes I highly recommend getting the fusion items with bulgogi or pork belly. The kimchi fried rice with an egg on top also cannot be missed. It's spicy but not so much that you don't enjoy the dish. A perfect balance. The service was also superb. I didn't get her name but the woman taking everyone's order was upbeat and really friendly and accommodating.  I also recommend, of the 4 sauces they bring you, to try/use the one with sesame seeds in it. 

Not sure why this place gets anything but 4 or 5 stars.

This place is great! The service was amazing. It was our first time in and the server offered to let us sample their different meats which was a log gesture. The value is amazing here, the meals are high quality and the price is cheap! Be sure to add fries to your meal for only $1, these fries are better than McDonald's! Great place guys.

Bolgogi everything!  Super affordable and generous,  delicious fusion combinations.   The Bolgogi pastrami was delish, as were the couple tacos.  Sadly there wasn't enough room for the cronut Sunday,  but it looked crazy.

Yes yes yes! I am SO happy that they have opened their Southwest location. It is literally right behind my son's charter school, so you may find me here any given day after school... I used to make the 30 minute trek all the way to their Decatur location, but it was just too far to do every week, so when I heard that they have opened much closer to my home, we had to stop in of course.

On our second visit to this location, Linda was as sweet as ever, remembering my family from months ago! The new location has plenty of seating, so there is no wait for a table anymore. However, when we ate here, there were only about 2 other occupied tables but TONS of people came in and out ordering take-out like I used to. However, the people that are doing take-out are missing out on the chips, guac, and salsa as well as the orange slices and fortune cookies! 

So, this is my second time ordering the tacos as lettuce wraps and I LOVE them! I watch my carbs when I am provided with alternatives and I love that I can get all the flavors that I love in a lettuce wrap. I ordered one of each protein: beef, pork, and chicken. In the 15+ times I've ordered from KoMex, I never tried the pork. I have been missing out. The flavors from the marinade really stand out and are so great. The bugulgi is wonderful as usual with its hints of sweetness. The chicken was good, but did not have the korean flavors as much as the other 2. I'd say if you're weary of Korean flavors, start with the chicken, but please please please try the beef and pork. They are amazing and you will not be let down. Always get kimchee on them, or on the side. I have also tried the tofu taco which is yummy and they said that the tofu taco is not naturally vegan, but they're able to make it vegan, so I can bring my vegan friends here!

My husband ordered the mixed fried rice that comes with every protein including shrimp, as well as the bugulgi burrito. My kids shared what we ate as well as spam masubi. We were stuffed and even had left-overs for about $30 before tip. My favorites are: lettuce wraps/tacos, burritos, chow fettuccine with beef and kim chee fried rice with spam. Make sure to try their korean hot sauce. It is the best! I love that I could technically eat here 5 days straight, yet be eating a different culture of food every day. Their menu is expansive, yet everything is done wonderfully. Thanks for being so welcoming Komex. We will see you soon!

Komex is amazing. Very original flavors. I always get the pork fuzion burrito and my wife loves the chicken. Used to go to the one on Decatur and was so happy I found they have new one here next to where I moved. They won't give me the hot sauce recipe but don't blame them its freakin awesome.!!

I love mash-up restaurants.  I live in  LA and come to Vegas often. I've been told about Komex a few times but never got around to it, until tonight.  WOw!!! The Bulgogi Chimichanga, and Fried Rice were super tasty.  I love Korean food, the ingredients they use are so good + sweet and salty is my thing.  I am Colombian, and have always felt Korean cuisine is somewhat similar,  as we both also use pork with many of our dishes.  
I will be back again this weekend to try the Bulgogi fries, which I heard were the BOMB!!! 

The portions are a great size and the pricing to me is extremely reasonable.  They have earned their 5 *****.
Best cushion in town. The owner is super sweet. The food is filling l, delicious, and a great price.

My daughter and I went and had a late dinner here. We were immediately greeted and were told we could take a seat anywhere we wanted.  The lady came and gave us placemats and the menus.  It took us a while just to order, not because service was slow, but because I couldn't decide what I wanted! There was so many yummy choices! 

My daughter ordered the Spam Musubi which were HUGE. She liked them and couldn't finish the 2nd one. One order comes with 2 musubi. There was an option to get them with egg, but she declined. I would have ordered it with, but that's neither here nor there. 

I ordered the chow fettuccine with beef bulgogi. I forgot to ask if I could get it without onion or bell peppers. I didn't mind it having it. That part was not overwhelming. The noodles were perfectly cooked and the whole dish had a black pepper and sesame oil taste to it. It was so delicious. I only ordered the half order after the server say it was actually more than half the size of a whole order. Needless to say, I still took half of it home. 

I ordered the bulgogi burrito for hubs when we ordered our food and asked her to make it "to go." Our server did not forget. She brought me a box, the check and my husband's burrito. 

This place is really good. The prices are really too good to be true.  I don't want to say cheap because to me that sounds negative for such delicious food. We will definitely be back here.
