First time I decided to try it & I ended up grabbing take out. The Philly sandwich was pretty good, except it was so soaked in grease that the bread turned into bread pudding. The fries were nothing special. I'd give them another chance for dining in.
The food is greasy and ill prepared. I'm only giving it three stars because of the bulgogi burrito  So unless you like sloppy, greasy, psuedo korean-mexican food avoid this place.

Komex in two words = Bold flavor. First time here and had a great experience. Had the pork burrito and it was awesome. Can't wait to visit again. Only reason why they didn't get 5 stars is because our waitress was slow. I guess she was dealing with a new system or something.

A fusion of Korean and Mexican dishes. The place is okay, average-but nice and clean. The servers are very friendly.

The Mexican slaw is good even without the additional dressing. I ordered the 2 meat combination bulgogi plate, bulgogi taco, and the hubs ordered the bulgogi bowl and meat skewers. The price is a bit on the mid range, above take out and below dine it. 

3 star because of its 'generous meat portions' - 
The meat is plenty and tender, however, it is not marinated enough, the flavor is okay but lacks a punch. Try it for variety but if you're looking for a different experience of Korean-Mex fusion, you're not going to find it here.
Pretty good Tacos which are big enough to actually need that second tortilla !

Same great food as their original location, but a much more convenient location. The place is bigger and they now have their liquor license. 

Anything from the fusion side of the menu is great. I have yet to try anything on the Mexican side. The beef fusion tacos are my fav. If you're going to dine in try any of the deep fried options like the chimichanga or flautas. 

Prices are still reasonable. You can feed a family of three for less than twenty bucks. It may not be as cheap as their original spot when they became popular a few years ago, but at least I don't feel guilty about paying the minuscule prices anymore. Some of the best cheap eats in town.

Don't forget to download the Epoxy app for their frequent diner card. It'll save you a few dollars down the road.

Yeah, the idea of fusion is strange for me. I still have trouble wrapping my head around things like this, but my boyfriend wanted to try it out, and I have to admit that I was curious too.

The menu has three pages: a straight Mexican page, a straight Korean page, and a page of Mexican/Korean fusion items that appear to be predominantly Mexican-based with Korean sauces added. We got two items off this menu: a fusion taco and a fusion chimichanga. We also ordered the bulgogi dish off the Korean menu.

These items are not the most authentic Korean or Mexican dishes you'll have, but they're not trying to be. It's fun fusion food with portions big enough for leftovers. The vegetables in my bulgogi dish were frozen, not fresh. Chicken was pretty good in the bulgogi dish though.

Service was friendly. I would do this again. Strange, but it works.

I'm so glad I looked through the yelp pics and noticed the pork belly on a stick! I didn't see it on the menu (the little insert was missing on my menu) so I asked the waitress about it. That was probably the highlight of our meal. I liked the burrito too, but the pork belly was the most memorable part of the meal.

I've been to this location a couple of times and each time our waitress/hostess was awesome!  Not sure if there was a different waitress that the other review was for, but we've had the same one each time.  The service was good, they were constantly refilling our drinks and making sure we had everything we needed.  

They have lettuce cups for taco shells if you're looking for a lower carb friendly option.  We've had the skewers, lettuce cup tacos, bulgogi burritos, bulgogi chimichangas, egg and spam musubi, nachos/fries... all have been delish!

Closed on Mondays, but their other location is open.

I love this place so much. Can't speak to the entire menu, but fusion tacos are maybe one of the best things to happen to mankind. Seriously. And you can get them in a lettuce wrap. Yessssssss.

Additional fantastic things about Komex:

Not only do they bring you chips and salsa but the chips are delicious AND come with a side of guacamole

They have four different hot sauces that they bring to your table and let you experiment with.

Your check comes with a fortune cookie and an adorably cut up orange as a palate cleanser

Did I mention that tacos are crazy inexpensive?!

Did I mention that lettuce-wrapped pork tacos are maybe one of the best things I've ever eaten?!!!!

Also, everyone that I've encountered working here has been completely lovely.

I'm sold.

Great menu, great food and great service. Definitely a place to revisit. Chips and salsa to start with fresh home made tortilla chips.  Quick and fresh food served. The portion sizes are very shareable and as usual our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. The tatertot nachos I will order as my meal next time. If you need a place for a group the place is large with a lot of tables. If you pay with cash you also get a five percent discount on your bill. That's a plus for me. They do accept cards too though. Try it out, I don't thing you will be disappointed.

Just went to the Buffalo location (have been to the Decatur location numerous times) because they're open on Sunday. It was so good, as expected. The waitress (who also works at the other location) was super friendly and on top of drinks. This location is bigger, seems cleaner, and was so speedy! Will definitely be back --- I love both locations!
Always one of my go to spots when I need a great bite to eat. Staff is super pleasant and the fish tacos are unmatched! Bulgogi is made to order.

I was thrilled to learn that a Komex had opened up a bit closer to my workplace. Love their food especially the fusion beef bulgogi and pork belly tacos. The Buffalo location is bigger even if the layout is a bit odd. A bar which looks like it will never be used, takes up a large portion of the room. 
This Komex isn't as hectic as the other smaller location at lunch time. However, during my first visit here with coworkers, someone apparently placed a large takeout order which resulted in waiting for our food for nearly 45 minutes. Even made to order food shouldn't take this long. They need to have enough staff to cook these call-in orders in order to not affect restaurant service. We were patient though and their food was delicious. 

I tried them again on a Saturday at lunchtime and the food came within 15 minutes and the service and food were spot on. I had fusion tacos again and my husband tried their enchiladas with different meats. So far so good.

But during my most recent visit on a weekday and lunchtime with coworkers, all sorts of things were off. The water tasted funny and they put the skimpiest portion of pork belly meat in one of my tacos. A coworker and I both asked for kimchi on the side. Hers was a generous portion and was on a small plate, like a true kimchi side dish. Mine? Well, it looked like a few kimchi shavings in a small tin container like what people use to hold ketchup or tartar sauce. I asked our waitress what was up and she said that the kimchi orders are the same (really?) and that there are 2 different chefs that made our items. So I got the short end of the deal then? Sigh. Anyway, our waitress never offered to remedy this blatant inconsistency in the food- which I thought was bad form. Food should be consistent even in the case of two different cooks/food preparers.

So if you're going to eat at this Komex, get ready to play some food roulette.

We chose to go the unconventional route and had our 30+ person wedding rehearsal dinner at Komex. Lynda was a pleasure to work with and made things so easy for us. We sent her a menu of what we wanted and an explanation of how we wanted the tables/chairs configured and her and the staff executed things perfectly. They did an amazing job staying on top of any additional orders we had to put in, clearing away plates, and keeping our buffet table clean and organized. 

I frequent Komex regularly and what I was most impressed by was their ability to present us with the same high quality food throughout the night since our party was so large, and they had other guests inside the restaurant that they were serving. We got a lot of bang for our buck here and I'm so glad we could share something we love about Vegas with our out-of-town guests. 

Bonus: they now have a TV inside and since the NBA playoffs were going on, guests didn't have to miss out on the games. 

Now that the wedding is over, I'll definitely be back to Komex for my favorite fusion cheesesteaks!

This place is just amazing. I love everything about it. The food is great, the price is fair. The selection is great as well. I love the idea of Mexican and Korean fusion, wish I could come here more but living in Henderson makes this place far.

Marketed as a Korean/Mexican fusion joint.  KoMex is somewhat lacking at both of those aspects.  They essentially are a standard Roberto's style restaurant quality that also serves fried rice, noodles (chow mien, etc.) and Mexican entrees with korean style meats like bulgogi, pork belly and the sort.  They also have pork belly saimen.  

I had the kimchee fried rice with shrimp.  All the ingredients were there.   A bit spicy and there was a good amount of shirmp in it.  It was pretty good, but then again how can you mess up fried rice really.  3.5/5

Members of our table ordered the fried fish plate w/fried rice.  A bulgogi enchalada, bulgogi tacos, french fries and the spicy wings.  All of these were of bar grub quality.  Fries were light & crispy but could have used some salt.  The wings looked like buffalo style wings with a touch of Thai chili.  The bulgogi enchelada and tacos were sub par in flavor and there literally was nothing else in the tacos but thinly sliced meat.  No sauce no onions or veggies.  Nothing much stood out. 2/5 overall

The restaurant itself was lacking in ambiance.  Very cafeteria-esque.  Too bright.  Much less inspired than similar places like L&L or Aloha Kitchen for example. 2/5

Not much of a chance for a return visit.

Great food.  Great service.  Definitely will go back.

It was our first time getting Korean BBQ so they gave us free samples of the meats.  

Cheesesteak was something special.

They made a plain Grilled Cheese for a cranky toddler.
Excellent! I had the bulgogi plate and I was not disappointed. It had great flavor and I highly recommend adding a side of kimchi! So delivious, amazing service and you can't beat the prices.

Super good. Super cheap. I'm echoing a lot of other reviews. The bulgogi fries are super tasty and super filling. I'm a big guy and my friend is a big eater and we were muscling through a half order. Three ppl would happily share a half order. 

The wings are worth splitting as well. Good flavor, the right amount of crispness without being dry. If you split those you're halfway to full. 

I typically go with a soft taco or two to round out the experience but they have a lot of other stuff besides tacos and burritos. Pork belly and fish and spicy pork are consistent favorites in the taco department and the fish plate itself is actually real good too. 

My only to tip is that they put too much cabbage and pico on their tacos. I just remove half of it before I chow down and eat the excess like a salad. Also eat the tacos as soon as they come out. The cold of the pico will cool down that meat in minutes. AND YOU DON'T WANT COLD MEAT!!!! (unless it's carpaccio)

Half order of bulgogi fries, 8 wings, two pork belly tacos (one flour, one corn), one carne asada taco (corn) for less than $22 cash* pre-tip. 

Also, I know for a fact the bulgogi bowl is good. It's like a less intimidating bibimbap. Also the pan fried fish is great, I like it with some of the fusion salsa more than the sauce it comes with.

This is amazing! Great fusion of the best Asian Mexican foods! Something for everyone. Great service even better prices and huge portions! Must try fusion nachos, kimchi fried rice, fusion sliders! Love!

I ordered takeout after work, and Komex makes the best fish tacos I've ever tasted!  Generous portions of lightly, crispy battered fish in a flour tortilla and topped with even more scrumptious mounds of pico de gallo salsa, which I also personally topped with a sweet chili sauce that I have at home, yummmers!!!  I have yet to try  their other menu meals, but I don't think I'll be too disappointed if they're half as good as the fish tacos!  ^_^

This place did not meet my expectations! The concept is really cool but besides that there is nothing really that makes me want to go back there. So sad because I love mexican food and korean food (obv). The restaurant has so much damn potential in name alone, 'komex', but it falls flat.

Just about anything on the menu you can get at a regular Mexican restaurant. There are influences of Korean dishes here and there but nothing that really explores the potential the KoMex genre implies. It seems more like a marketing attempt (a poor one at that) at capitalizing the Korean food craze right now. I'm all up for it but give us something unique, KoMex! There's just no creativity at all.

The interior/atmosphere is a mess. Was it previously an Aloha Kitchen or a Hawaiian bar that was converted to a restaurant last minute? I don't know what I'm looking at with all the coconut leaves. Definitely not even a semi-business setting or a place for couples unless you want to look like a cheap date. At the very least it looks decent for families and friends lol

After spending 5 minutes inspecting the interior and the menu (which was probably designed on Microsoft Word), I got it. They aren't trying to be the next hot thing. You come here to eat decent mexican food, that's it. Whatever imagination you had envisioned in your mind by hearing the word KoMex you can throw it out the window. Appreciate the place for its simplicity and food because FWIW it's not terrible, just not awe-inspiring.
This place is great, I've been here a couple times now and the server is always very polite and attentive and unbelievably friendly. Also the food is delicious. I strongly recommend this place.

My son and I decided to try a new restaurant today so glad we found this hidden gem everything was excellent. They had me at pork belly on a stick "finger licking good". 

It's safe to say we've found us a new spot!!

Not fast food, fused food.

Picking up some toys from the "Toys for Tater Tots" drive, I figured I should at least take a break and see what this place is all about, I mean, I'm a sucker for any place that serves burritos. 

I went with the "Fusion Burrito" with every intention of eating this while driving around Vegas, but when I saw the size of this bad boy I knew this was a sit down snack job. The Fusion Burrito is a monster filled with your choice of meat and Mexican rice, green & brown onions, pico, cilantro, and lettuce. I went with the bulgogi spicy pork and it was delicious, the lettuce was crunchy and the meat had great flavor, but I do feel the burrito had more filler than meat. I need more meat Komex!

I should have gone with the double your meat option and I do recommend anyone to do this when getting a burrito from Komex. Was it good? Of course it just needed more meat and less rice. Plus, the house made hot sauces are the business, seriously, If I was allowed I probably would have just poured the green sauce all over my burrito. Nummy nummers!

A great place for a few beers and a quick bite, but next time I'm running a train on some of their famous tots.

My boyfriend and I got the fusion burrito and the fusion fries during our visit. He got spicy pork in his burrito and I got pork belly on my fries. For the amount you pay the portion was decent for the fries. They tasted great except I felt like there was barely any pork belly. Also, since pork belly is a bit more expensive than the other meats I expected to receive more. 

My boyfriend enjoyed the burrito and I say it's worth it because it is pretty huge. 

You also get orange slices and fortune cookies at the end of your meal so that's a plus. Overall this place is good.

Our first time here the food was really good. We had ordered Kimchi fried rice and bulgogi. The food is made to order, and they give a lot! A little pricey but it was worth it especially since I share my plates with my 4 and 2 year old.! Very flavorful foods.

The second time we came the food was very oil and the portion wasn't big like the first time.
Been coming her for years. Family owned and operated. The Bulgogi burrito is my favorite. You will want to try everything on the menu.
Great comfort food and food  comes out quick ! Love the sliders and good service. When you pay with cash you 5% off the bill.

I finally got to try the-oh-so talked about KoMex! I love the concept; I especially love Korean food so I was extremely thrilled to try this place out. 

We went here on a Saturday night around 6pm. The place was dead. It was seriously just me and my boyfriend. It was a little awkward but overall I did not mind it too much. A few tables were labeled "Reserved" so we were hoping that people would roll in when we were there. We stayed there for more than an hour during our meal, no sign of any other human life form except for our waitress who was super friendly by the way. 

To start, we ordered 1/2 Beef Bulgogi Nachos. It was delicious. The meat was so tender and it was really flavorful. The combination of the sweet sauce blended so well with the pico and jalapenos. We ordered the Bulgogi burrito next and then three tacos with three different meat: beef bulgogi, pork and chicken. All of the meats were cooked perfectly and the flavors were spot on. The burrito was made well in my opinion. You know how when they make burritos, one side has all the beans and the other side has all the meat? Here they make it so that every bite is all the combination of the meat, pico, rice, etc. It was just so good that I was able to finish the whole burrito. And trust me, it was massive! 

I will definitely come back here to get my burrito fix.

1. Kimchi salsa
2. Bulgogi burrito
3. Go!

Pros:
   Great Korean Mexican Fusion
   Decent Service
   Decent Prices
   Serves Beer and Soju
   This location EZ Parking and Not Packed
Cons:
   Decor could use a little bump

Yummy Korean Mexican fusion. Big portions and friendly service. We ordered a bulgogi burrito, kimchi fried rice, bulgogi fried rice and a variety of tacos. Kimchi fried rice was my favorite, had plenty of meat and great kimchi flavor. Would come back on my next visit to Vegas!

Wow. What a great find. We love the food. The Bulgogi bowl was so delicious. We also had the pastrami and Bulgogi beef on something like a French bread. Both were delicious. Very reasonable prices. Highly recommend. The Bulgogi bowl was the best thing I've eaten in a restaurant in a long while.

I've been here two times since this location opened, and I will definitely be back. The food is incredible and the service is great. The flautas are delicious! You can get a
combination of meats in each of the flautas. I tried the pork, the beef, and the chicken. The pork is definitely the standout though all three were delicious. I love all the sauces they offer. The green one is my fave! I wish they would put it in squirt bottles though to avoid cross contamination from previous customers.

I placed a to-go order over the phone and the staff was courteous and the process was easy. By the time I arrived, the food was ready so I was in and out of the restaurant in 10 min.

What I ordered:
-Kimchi fried rice
-Korean chicken wings
-Bulgogi fries

All in all, the food was ok. I probably would bump this up to 4 stars if I had actually dined in because the food (fries especially) were a tad cold. Im sure had it been fresh the bulgogi fries would've been bomb! The sweet and spicy sauce on the chicken wings were pretty good, but I feel like I've had better. 

I would recommend this place because it has a lot of variety, esp. how there's a mix of both Korean and Mexican food. I have yet to explore their "Mexican" menu, but tbh there's other Mexican joints around that I don't feel the need to try it out.

Favorite place for cheap filling calamari tacos.  Th is one of those very well priced Asian fusion places. Great service fast and you wont be spending more than 15 bucks here. 

Calamari fusion tacos: 9/10.  Always cooked perfectly and with a great flavor combination. They will give a bunch of sauces. Try them out! There super delicious. The green compliments this taco very well. 

Fish fusion taco. 8.5/10. The fish is very well seasoned and cooked perfectly. I usually add the spicy red or green sauce for this. But doesn't need it. 

They are definitely other food items to try there. But hands down best calamari taco I have ever had. Have to order them every time.

Here at KoMex (Buffalo & Flamingo Rd) for lunch with wifey. Full order of Bulgogi beef fried rice for me. 3 lettuce tacos for her (1beef & 2tofu). Service is decent and friendly. Food is fresh and different. Fusion of Mexican and Korean is a great mix. I have been here before and had the fusion burrito too. It's big and disappears fast when put down in front of me. They give you a little carousel of spices and sauces with the food...tip: the sweet-spicy one is the best.  Prices are + or - 10 bucks per person. I like it and will be back again.
Great food and very friendly staff. Waitress was helpful and the restaurant was very clean.

This place is amazing the steak tacos are so flavorful. Everything I tried I've really enjoyed.  The service is also very attentive.  If you have not experienced komex go n try it, you won't be disappointed. ..

Wow, exceptional food! Perfect balance of Korean and Mexican. Either one was delicious! I ordered bulgogi plate with a side of kimchi. Bulgogi was well seasoned with authentic Korean flavor. I also shared a bulgogi pastrami sandwich with the hubby. At first I was suspicious, but man I'm glad someone stepped out to be creative and make that sandwich. It was totally bomb!!

You have not lived until you have ate KoMex!!! I use to eat at the Decatur location ALL the time and I am super excited that this new location is less than a mile away now! That can be either good or bad :-/ it's not the most healthy food but it for sure hits the spot every time! Tonight I placed a to-go order which seems to be the more efficient and time effective way to get your food without much of a wait! I do know that they are a fresh to order kind of place so it's not like you can walk in and anything on the menu is already prepared! Tonight I ordered the Bulgogi quesadillas and the musubi with spam and a fried egg! Delicious! I usually get the Bulgogi fries but tonight I switched it up! This place is a MUST! If you're looking to order a cocktail they do have a bar in this location which is most definitely a PLUS! Go KoMex!

I always enjoy KoMex! My 1/2 Korean girlfriend & I are foodies and aren't food snobs in anyway but not sure what people expect from a FUSION spot??? They've done an excellent job of bringing our favorite foods together & the customer service is always on point and friendly! Check the photos - they don't lie...

So I just moved down the street and wanted to give Komex a try. We ordered chimichangas, tacos and flautas. Everything was good but the FLAUTAS were by far our favorite. The only con is too much Pico de Gallo.  But they are a nice twist on the local taco shop. Ordered to go. The Ladies up front are super nice. We can't wait to try out more items.

We heard aboutKoMex from friends and found our first opportunity to visit. We went in for an early lunch yesterday, on Saturday. We were greeted immediately and welcomed, which I like. The staff explain the uniqueness of the food right away. I love the variety of items on the menu. Right away the fusion guacamole and the cole slaw caught my eye.
My husband really enjoyed the full bulgogi plate with chicken and pork and rice. I was very happy with three good sized chicken flautas which came with guac and cole slaw, sour cream and salad. It was enough of a meal to take half home for today ($8).
We know we will be back soon! You have to check out these wild flavors!!

I finally got to try komex. I had a fish taco, pork taco, chicken taco, beef taco, and pork belly taco. The fish taco was fried. I asked the waitress if it was grilled or fried and I was told it was grilled. That was a minus. The pork, chicken, and beef tacos were all ho-hum. Nothing special. Beef was probably the best of the 3. The pork belly taco was very good. Best thing I ate. Surprisingly, the sauces were really good. I'm thinking try should bottle the sauces and sell them. There were 3 red and 1 green sauce. The reds were super good.
LOVE the flavors in the bulgogi beef dishes. AWESOME beef over tater tots!  Decadent! I don't have locations near me, but it's worth the travel!

This was my first time ever trying korean/Mexican fusion food and it was a a delicious surprise. I ordered a fusion burrito and fusion nachos and fries with kimchi. The servings are HUGE so make sure you come with a big appetite. I couldn't finish my food and had to take it home. I would definitely suggest ordering the fusion fries with kimchi.

I have been wanting to try Komex for a long time now and finally stopped in for lunch. I ordered the fusion nachos with the beef and my husband ordered the fusion chimichanga with the bulgogi beef. While we were waiting for our food to come out we were served a basket with chips, salsa, and guacamole.  The salsa was okay but I was impressed with the guacamole. It was a bit more chunky than what I make but had super good flavor!

Onto the nachos and chimi, we were both pleasantly surprised how well the sweet garlicky beef married with the Mexican flavors of the nachos and they didn't skimp on the toppings.  I asked for hot sauce and our server brought out a caddy that had 4 different ones. By far our favorite was the chunky salsa that was spicy and sweet at the same time.  The true star of the show was the finely chopped bulgogi beef,so tender and delicious. 

We will definitely come back!!!

First time here a few weeks ago. We stopped in because it's near the house and I kept seeing it on Yelp. I wasn't too impressed with the flavor combinations, but that's just me. I will definitely have to try again to update my review.

Their lemonade is yummy! I had the fusion half fries half nachos and it was so yummy.  My friend loved the fusion chimichanga.  Their spam musubi was delicious and I definitely recommend the cronut for dessert!

Oh man, I haven't been to KoMex in years, and I still remember when the Korean Mexican fusion cuisine was a hit. I've been to their original Decatur location many times in the past, but this was my first visit to this location.

Food was as good as I remembered it to be. My friend and I started out with a half order of the bulgogi fries. I'm actually not a fan of bulgogi, but these bulgogi fries consisting of cheese, bulgogi, pico de gallo, and jalape√±os were bomdiggity! Even the half portion is huge so it can definitely be split amongst multiple people. 

The pork belly taco was simply constructed yet really tasty. The pork belly was really moist and crispy and the refreshing pico de gallo and cole slaw complemented the pork belly surprisingly well. Personally, I would have thrown in some kimchi in there too. My friend recommended me to eat it right away, because the pico de gallo would cool the pork belly down which made sense. 

Their wings were the biggest surprise. I didn't expect much, but it was probably the highlight of the meal for me. Very flavorful, sweet and savory, with enough spice to make your body drop a sweat. Wings can tend to be really dry, but they were cooked to perfection. I will definitely be back for those wings!

The young lady that was serving us was pleasant and accommodating. The owner/manager lady (I think?) even heard my fork drop when she was inside the kitchen so she brought me a new one. Kudos to that!

Great food. Love the burritos and flautas. Usually when I go there is only one waitress working though so I don't know what it's like when busy. The wings are amazing!!!!! I need to know what's in their sauce!!!
Delicious beef and the enchiladas and beef with rice is delicious! My husband and I also tried the sweet potato fries which were very good. Will definitely be back!

Great initial idea. Korean flavored beef in Mexican preparations and they do it pretty well. Bulgogi burritos and quesadillas are nice. 

It's a dive joint and maybe I want to much. I wish they would finish the thought and make some Mexican flavored Korean dishes. Carnitas noodle bowls or something
I love the food, super sweet service, and it gets super busy during 6:00- 8:00 Linda is super sweet she keeps checking on us.
Ordered the wings with fries and chicken on a stick. Delicious food all around, definitely will be back!

You may not be impressed with the decor but you will be impressed with the food .
Make sure they bring you the homemade Korean hot sauce so up can put it on everything .
I had slider 3$ tacos 2$ ea and three meat skewers $7
All were good and had complimentary chips and salsa to start and orange slice and fortune cookie at the end.
Friendly service and family friendly dining.

We don't come here nearly enough. But every time we do we are never disappointed. The burritos, fried rice the free chips and salsa as you wait for your order, everything is super tasty. As a person of Mexican heritage I am happy that someone had the idea for this fusion!

Excellent! Food was delicious. Service was great. Nice friendly family run restaurant. 

Must try bulgogi flautas!
This is my husbands favorite restaurant. He lived in Korea for two years, so he's very picky about his bulgolgi. We love the fusion flautas, fusion nachos, and the awesome service that never fails.
This is place is bomb! Food is definitely great and tastes delicious! Lots of choices too!

Had the bulgogi plate (chicken and beef) last night while while my love had the chimichanga. My plate was delicious: big portion and lots of flavor in the meat. My love had no complaints about his chimichanga...service was great and the waitress was very attentive. They have a big selection of Mexican/Korean fusion dishes - I gotta come back and try their flautas :)

YUMMY!!! I have been dying to try this place! I ordered the bulgogi nachos and it was a lot of food! The meat was juicy and the ingredients were amazing. 
The komex sauce is a must try. 
I also usually hate coke but I tried the Mexican coke here, wow that's actually good. 
Mexican coke is waaaaayyy better than American coke that's for sure! 
I heard it's made with real sugar and that's why it tastes better.
Order the nachos for sure if you're craving some interesting flavors!

Actually kinda shocked... When I first got in I thought the combination made no sense to me... Restaurant without an identity... I was ready to yelp badly..... However the food was quite tasty and not too overpriced... They could use some help on their decorations..... Shrimp tacos were excellent and bilbogi was great.... Totally recommend this place!!!!!
Wow just tried the kimchi fried rice and it was fantastic. I called and ordered for pickup and it was ready on time. Thanks, I'll be back.

I love this Korean Mexican fusion spot! My favorite is their Spam Kim chee fried rice and their fish tacos is to die for! They also serve salsa and chips which so addictingly good and at the end of every meal they give you a piece of orange!

The food is absolutely amazing! The parent restaurant (Komex Express) is just as good if not better. I was doing some research on the previous yelp reviews posted and one customer feels that this is a let down compared to the other location. I do not agree with that comment since the original chef from Komex express works at this location, and all of the meats are marinated on site and delivered to the Decatur location daily to keep the flavors consistent. So how could the two restaurants possibly not compare?! This continues to be my favorite weekly dinner spot and I'm happy to see that the new location is a success. My compliments to the owners for another success!

Amaaazing!!!
Korean and Mexican marriage is phenomenal!!

Ordered the tots with bulgogi - sour cream sauce with bulgogi and pork and scallions and bacon- heeeaveeennn

Bulgogi cheesesteak- knock your socks off delicious!! Super cheesy and flavorful you will be pleasantly surprised

Chicken wings- crispy. Spicy. Sweet. Delicious!!!!

Bulgogi bowl- so friggin good - the cole slaw and spinach salad with rice is crispy and refreshing with the rice and fatty and flavorful bulgogi beef!!

Tacos- great! Ordered the pork tacos nomzzzz

Will definitely be back everything was so reasonably priced!! Delicious and awesome!!!

Who would have thought the best grilled cheese I've ever had would have come from a burrito place... and a Korean/Mexican fusion burrito place at that. 

Seriously, the grilled cheese is three dollars and is the best I've ever had. Bulgogi beef, melty cheese and sourdough. Where has this been all my life? 

Other appetizers than the grilled cheese included short ribs and some sort of fried fish, which were good but not great, but maybe had an unfair shot being put up against the grilled cheese... which i think i mentioned was pretty good.  

As far as the actual specialties... the fusion burrito is a combination of what you would find in a traditional Burrito (rice, lettuce, cheese etc), but with Bulgogi beef and kimchi (ask for it inside). Throw on on spicy fusion sauce and you've got something that makes you wonder why this "Komex" country doesn't actually exist, if only for the food.  

Service was good, prices reasonable. Only drawbacks are

1. The inside feels something like a mix between the DMV and a classroom
2. Chips and salsa/guac seemed like an afterthought - but hey if you are giving it to me for free I will not dock you for it.

Hurts me, seriously, it PAINS me to give 3 stars. I want to give 5. But the truth is, it only deserves 2!

I absolutely LOVED the orginal Komex. LOVED IT. I loved the fettucine dish, the calamari tacos, the quesodilla. All soooooo good. I figured, since it's the same owners, just a new location, it will be the same food.

WRONG......Nope. Not at all. 

It seems like all the flavor that makes Komex stand out was GONE here. No love man, no love. My fettucine dish was boring. There was nothing there. Barely a hint of the spices that make it taste so good. 

Maybe, just maybe it's because we ordered it to go. 

This place FINALLY shows up on my side of town...awesome!......only to find it is just eh, I've had better.

I will try it again, and eat in this time. I'm looking forward to bumping it up to the 5 stars I think they truly are!

I have heard a lot about KoMex Fusion so when a new location opened up near me, I wanted to give it a try. The place was packed, but luckily there were still 2 open tables to choose from. I have no idea how many employees were in the back, but I only saw the same two girls working the whole time and they were doing a fantastic job at keeping all of the tables taken care of. Our server took the time to go over the menu with us and suggest things we might like try. 

After my "Mexican Coke" was brought to the table some complimentary chips, salsa and guacamole soon arrived. The guac was fresh and delicious! The salsa had a nice fresh flavor too. Hubby and I decided to order a few different things to try buffet style between us. 

Fried Wonton's ($1.50) - These came 5 to an order and were good! They were stuffed with green onion, ground beef & pork. The dipping sauce that came with it was sweet and yummy. 

Chicken Flauta ($2) - The flavor was very good and I can't even describe it, you will just have to try one of these tasty flautas yourself! It had some sour cream and pico de gallo on the plate as well. 

Fusion Tacos ($1.75 & $2.25 for flour tortilla) - I tried the pork and beef with one being on a corn tortilla and one on a flour tortilla. They weren't totally bad, but nothing spectacular to me. 

Beef Chow Fettuccine ($8.50) - This was the dish hubby wanted to try most. The cabbage and carrots were left out, but the portion was still hearty. The flavor of this dish was something new for me and I liked it. You can't go wrong on this dish with the price, portion and flavor. 

At the end of the meal fortune cookies and a fresh orange were brought to us. The orange was a light and tasty finish to our meal. I was very pleased with the service, taste and price here at KoMex Fusion!

How good can a place be that serves both Korean and Mexican??!    FANTASTIC!  Sat right down, got served chips and salsa....the orders were up quick, portions are huge and everyone had a smile on their faces for around $30 for three adults. I hope to go back this weekend!

Such great food! Really good mix of both styles. I ordered the Fusion Chimichanga. It was so large I didn't know where to start :-) . My boyfriend ordered their calamari taco, some wontons and shrimp ceviche. He loved all if it! The Calamari as really good. Would be awesome if they had it just as an appetizer on its own as well. Wonton soup was good too!

Craving Mexican food at the time but then changed my mind driving to the taqueria. Decided to go to my favorite Chinese restaurant (Oasis A.K. ) because they cook cashew chicken and lo mein the way I like it. Needed drinks for dinner went to the Walgreens on Buffalo and Flamingo. Needed to make a U-turn to get to the Chinese place so I drive through the little strip mall and seen KoMex Fusion. Wonder what it was all about and Yelped it. Seen good reviews on it and decided to give it a try. Now I don't know about Devine intervention but this is it. First I was craving Mexican but then decided on Chinese. I know it wasn't Korean food but something led me to this place. First time here so looked over the menu. I "Fused" what I like at Oasis A.K. chicken and lo mein. Ordered the Chow Fettuccine w/chicken. Thank you for whom ever guided me to this place. I will be coming to this place a 2nd time to try another item. Most likely the bulgogi tacos or nachos or maybe the rice bowl. Everything looks good. Except the Spam items. Don't do Spam not even when it's with email. Huge portions also! Well worth the$$$ though on yelp it's only one $. Which means good food at a cheap price.

So good!  Mexican and Korean. Put your hands together!  It's the best of both. 
Surprisingly the wonton soup was good too. Had the pork belly tacos. So good.  Also had kimchi fried rice. Delish. I liked the chicken wings but sauce too thick. Will return.

First time here, service was good and fast, food was excellent.  Tacos were big and my bulgogi was perfect, No kids menu, but when we ordered they offered kid size for us.  Great place and we will be back

We came here yesterday for lunch. Actually we wanted to go the restaurant next door but it was closed on Sundays so we decided to try this place. You get homemade fresh nachos with salsa and guac with the meal. We had their specials on the menu. It was Bulgogi Tater Tots consisting of tater tots, bulgogi, sour cream, bacon bits, tomatoes and green onions. It was crunchy and appetizing.

We also has Bulgogi skewers which was my favorite, very tender and satisfying. Pork belly skewers was ok. 

Interior was very casual. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. It's a great place to eat and doesn't break the bank.

Sometimes in life, God drops a blessing and just so happens Komex is one of them. I enjoy everything about this place! The food here is amazing. I enjoyed the beef tacos as well as the Kim chee fried rice. This place does not disappoint and every time I come to Vegas, I make sure I stop here and get some food.  The service was friendly and fast. Overall a must go if you are in town!!

KoMex is a solid restaurant if your looking for a quick meal. They are located in the same parking lot as Baby Stacks on the corner of Flamingo and Buffalo. The service is pretty good and so is the food...but don't expect to be blown away. Ive been here three times, and each time has been the same...average.

So I live in Orange County, where Kogi is a household name now. You know, the whole Korean-Mexican craze that took over all of LA/OC a few years back... my wife and I tried the food once and found it to be oily/greasy, salty, and just overpowering in general. It just didn't strike the right chord with us. We took a break from Korean-Mexican after making it ourselves at some point after that (and being a lot more satisfied). After perusing Yelp to satisfy/compromise between our friends' desires for tacos and my wife's cravings for Korean, we settled on KoMex, which was just around the corner from where we were staying. We phoned our orders in and picked the food up before the concert-folks headed out to see Mariah. 

Wow, was this the right decision. The food was awesome. Not overly greasy (for the bulgogi nachos and fries), well-seasoned, and just perfectly balanced. Here's the sheet of stuff we ordered, roughly:

- kimchi fried rice (beef)
- fusion tacos (bulgogi, spicy pork and pork belly)
- bulgogi bowl
- bulgogi fusion burrito
- 1/2 order bulgogi fries
- 1/2 order bulgogi nachos

So two of the people eating are Korean, and my wife grew up eating Korean food. So all were on them for feedback. I'm pretty sure it was a hit, because everything with the exception of the huge kimchi fried rice order, was gone by the end (this was shared between 6 between). Everybody loved their food, and the only reason the kimchi fried rice was left over was because everyone was so stuffed. Don't worry, a couple of us finished off the kimchi fried rice the next morning (really good stuff and they don't mess with trying to make this one fusion, which is a good call - just keep it simple). The bulgogi was probably the star of the night, as it found its way into most of our stuff :) I really liked the pork belly taco though - it's not the soft pork belly but more like the well-cooked/almost-crispy style pork belly that you'd cook up at KBBQ (samgyeupsal). Man, I should have ordered several of those instead. The bulgogi fries were great though slightly oily/soggy at the bottom and not crispy, for some reason... it didn't matter and these tasted delicious. Furthermore, these, along with the nachos were completely obliterated. 

So if you're craving something different and have heard of Korean-Mexican fusion or tried it before, I'd highly recommend this place. Pricing is reasonable and the food is really good. Oh, make sure to get the hot sauce on side :)

Love this place! Food displays passion, finesse, and real ingenuity.  The Korean Mexican fusion works. It is good and honest food that does not try to be what it is not.  It is not froufrou fancy.  If you come for that (as some have), then sure, you will be disappointed.  It ain't Nobu.  But it's better in some ways.  It is garden variety comfort food with an exotic twist.  The service is friendly and attentive, although a bit slow. No worries. Take time and do not rush. The atmosphere is totally disjointed and crazy. A lone and unattended (really, abandoned bar) sits off by its lonesome...making no sense whatsoever. There is a framed child's Korean dress (han bok?) and a child's Mexican dress on the wall. Like something a crazy aunt who never married might have. Never you mind! This place is worth a trip, and you might find it a keeper.

Tacos were excellent! Sojuritas would have been amazing if they were fresh made instead of with bottled sugary soda. 

Owner is super sweet and very helpful.

I get the fusion fries with the spicy chicken (not listed as an option but they say yes if I ask). My absolute favorite with their house-made hot sauce. The second I smell it whenever I pick up my food, I literally cannot stop salivating on the way home. Thankfully I'm only 1 1/2 minutes down the street.

came here to have lunch with my husband.  Granted there is a sign near the cash register that says it's NOT A FAST FOOD place BUT, there was no sign that said ... your wontons, and my husband ordered a plate, it had rice, kim chee, some meat and an egg ... it took them 45 minutes to bring my won tons.  10 minutes later, they brought the rest of the food out and we just had them pack it up.
This place is the bomb. Beef bulgogi fried rice is great. Large portion and may even be enough for two people. Staff is friendly. Bring cash to get discount.
Korean BBQ tacos?!?! Yes yes and yes. Delicious! Although at night sometimes the meat is a little dry. I love their kimchi fried rice too,

This is a great place if you enjoy mexican and/or korean food and also if you appreciate a fusion of both. Ive been to this location many times and have had all good experiences so far. The service has also been courteous and polite and every dish we try has been delicious!!! We've tried most of the menu and its all been tasty! But my favorites have been their bulgogi nachos and also the bulgogi quesadillas.... wow amazing!! You have to give this place a try.

We had this recommended to us by a friend and I thought the mixture of the 2 was really weird. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have some really great food. I've been here 2 times now and out of everything that Ive had so far, the nachos are my favorite. If they had these nachos at a random movie theater that theater would own all. The kalbi  sticks are a great quick snack. Service is fast and the lady we had explained things very well especially at explaining how hot some of the meals are.

For the type of place this is I can't really imagine it any better.

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  Decor in different parts of the restaurant don't really work well together (ie: bamboo wallpaper vs. Korean-Mexican cartoons). 

LIKE  Larger space than the other location which means little to no wait at all. Location is closer to home. The complimentary chips with guacamole and salsa.

LOVE  The fusion concept. The amount of food for the price. The kimchi fried rice. The musubi with fried egg. The knowledgeable and energetic server. The different options for almost each entree.

I used to go north komex location.
I was really big fan of this place.

Their bulgogi fushion burrito and kimchi fried rice are my favoriate !!

We are regulars of Komex
I have tried several things on the menu and enjoyed them all
My personal favorite is kimchi fried rice with pork for the meat it is delicious and spicy (love kimchi and spicy food)
Spam masubi with or without egg and it a nice big severing and you get 2
Plenty of different drinks to choose from usually just get water, if it's cold out then hot white/green tea which they serve in a nice pot 
Highly recommend trying Komex

Found the new location in my hood and couldn't be happier about it. Empty for dinner last Friday night but not for much longer. The new space is large and has a bar, with beer and wine coming soon according to the owner. These are super nice and hard working people that will make this place wildly successful in these parts I'm guessing. Delicious bulgogi flautas and a cheeseteak I'm still thinking about if you're wondering what we had. Same great food, and now unlimited potential in this new spot. I see big things for this place here and probably 10 more pounds around my gut. This city's affordable food options get better every day.

Combination chow fettuccini is so good and the bulgogi tarot totz are the appetizer of choice feeling for something spicey and I mean spicey go for the kimchi fried rice combination with bulgogi shrimp and I switch out chicken for spam so good

Love this place! My aunt and uncle introduced my family and I to this spot while vacationing in Vegas a while back and this by far is one of the best restaurants ever! The customer service is great, the food is fantastic, and the price isn't bad either! I recommend it to anyone looking to try something new or just simply experience fusion dining.

The food was wonderful. My friends and I ordered the tacos and lettuce wraps. I couldn't complain about the food at all.

The reason for the four stars is because the service was so slow. We had to wait about 20 minutes just to order our food after we were seated.
The Bugogi grilled cheese was my favorite but everything else I had was delicious too. Highly recommend this place.

I love Korean and Mexican food! Whoever thought of this was a genius! I found Komex on yelp and went on a Sunday evening. We went at around 6pm and it slowly got packed. We ordered the bulgogi (beef and chicken), fried rice, fish lettuce wrap, spam musubi and wonton soup. Everything was pretty tasty but my favorite was the fried rice. It was hot, fresh, flavorful, and had tons of beef, chicken and shrimp. Service was excellent and the portions are very big. We ordered 1/2 orders and still had leftovers. Prices are also reasonable for the amount of food you get. I love their food and will definitely be back when I'm in town.

I'm always super skeptical of fusion foods, because they usually don't turn out that great... but KoMex is definitely an exception. The service is noticeably wonderful and I like that they have both tables and bar seating. 

The food portions are huge, especially for the price. I ordered the Bulgogi Rice Bowl ($8) which has bulgogi, rice, KoMex slaw, jalapenos, kimchi, lettuce, a fried sunny side up egg, and this spicy sauce. It was filling and the amount of spice was just right. Of course there is a rack of hot sauce for the more daring diners.

This happens to me a lot... but my friends usually order something better than what I have. Apparently for a limited time only, KoMex is serving Bulgogi Tater Tots ($9) which are tater tots topped with bulgogi, pork belly, bacon, sour cream, tomatoes, green onions, cheese. Best late night meal you can possibly ask for. Anyone who loves potatoes will be floored by the Bulgogi Tater Tots, so give them a try before they're off the menu!

There are so many great options on the menu, all of them with raving reviews on Yelp, so I can't wait to go back and try more.

Nothing bad to say about this place. Nachos are outstanding, bulgogi burrito is superb, and spicy pork tacos are phenomenal! The flavors here from Korean to Mexican food mash so well together.. It's like they perfected it. Never once have been disappointed in ordering something from here. This is the tastiest fusion and prices are very reasonable for portions. I really wish that one day this place opens up on some busier street corners with late night hours, because I can see this being a popular late night muchie meetup spot! I highly recommend Komex if your looking for guaranteed good food and to try something new.

Came here for brunch with a bunch of us. First time for me.

The menu is very interesting, Korean Mexican Fusion food. We ordered the Fusion Fries, fries, topped with salt, cheese, and Bulgogi beef. It actually tasted pretty good!

Bulgostrami, Bulgogi beef & Pastrami sandwich. It was a huge portion! The mix of taste was pretty interesting, in a good way. The sandwich was so big, I shared it with my friend.

Definitely will come back to try the other items in the menu!

This is one of my favorite places i could eat here everyday!:) Service is usually pretty quick and the staffs are so nice. Free chips and salsa the moment you sit. We always end up ordering Fusion Bulgogi Nachos less the jalapenos, it's really good!! Just a tip: Make sure to request for their Korean sauce, it goes well with anything!

Less busy than the original site, but all the great flavors are still here.

Ordered fusion tacos and chimichanga as well as a bulgogi plate and kimchi fried rice. Everything was absolutely flavorful and delicious, achieving the balance of mexican and korean. 

Portions were huge for the price too.

I Highly Recommend planning to make a stop here if you are in Vegas.
Good salsa, great guac & chips. The pork belly taco was delish. Beef bulgogi bowl with egg was spicy. Perfect for a cold night. Friendly service. Nice to have another neighborhood hit!

Cute little hang out spot. I wish I lived closer! I would definitely come back here to try new items. 

The server was great. Fast and quick to attend to our needs. 

What to order:
Bulgogi tater tots - my favorite item on the menu
Pork belly musubi - so big. I want to try it with the spam next time 
Bulgogi cheese steak - also, another favorite item on the menu. Cheesy and juicy 
Kim chi fried rice with egg - I was expecting it to be in one of those oven bowls where the rice gets crispy. Wish it was! Still good though
Tacos - alright 

Give this place a try! You won't be disappointed.

It was pretty dead because it was fight night. The service was friendly and fast. We tried the specials and they were very tasty. I also adored the calamari taco wrapped in lettuce. Oh my it was good!!!. Hubby really enjoyed pork belly taco and pork belly on a stick. He is stuck in a pork belly rut. Nice flavors. We will be back.

First Korean Mexican fushion I've ever went to!

In the morning, it was empty - the waitress was very nice and kept checking up on us and talked to us sweetly; really brightened my day!

Ordered the dak-bulgogi burrito with kimchi: And OMG, the kimchi was really good, pretty authentic kimchi - just like the type my grandmother makes :)

The burrito was HUGE - (And not in that way, for the minds in the gutter lol), and stuffed with friend rice, lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro, pico de gallo, cilantro, and dak-bulgogi (which is korean chicken). 

Only wish that the hot sauces were more spicier, they didnt have any form of spice to me! But will come back again :)

Saw Komex on a BuzzFeed video, knew I had to try it the moment I saw it. While traveling from California I paid a visit and it was DELICIOUS. The chicken bulgogi fries are to die for. The waiters are extremely friendly and nice so that's a plus! Please open a location in Los Angeles!!!!!!!
The food here is delicious as fuuuuu. The burritos and chimichangas are huge ( not exaggerating). The service is awesome aswell and it's only one server.

If you want great food, excellent service and a lot of it.....come here!  My burrito was huge....and my son's PBBLT was yummy!  I can't say enough good things about this place.......we'll be back very soon!

Besides the booze, clubs, gambling, and all the other glitz and glamour that makes me want to come back to Vegas, this place is up there!

As a Californian, I've had my fair share of Korean-Mexican food (hello bool, Kogi, and Calbi trucks).  When I found out there was a dedicated Korean-Mexican food place on yelp in Vegas, I couldn't help but have to try it.  Dare I say, it is better than all the Korean-Mexican food trucks in LA?! 

I recommend ordering bulgogi as your meat choice in whatever you order. We ended up ordering the bulgogi quesadilla, bulgogi flautas, and the half order bulgogi fries.  All were absolutely delicious.  Their bulgogi is moist and full of flavor.  The portions were huge, better than what I expected.  For the two of us, we barely finished most of those three dishes even though we were starving. The bulgogi fries are basically a carne asada fries but WAY better since they use bulgogi and the Korean hot sauce complements it well. A half order of fries is enough for three people to share.

Although it is located away from the Strip, trust me it is worth the drive out of the glitzy area to this place.  It is located off of Buffalo and Flamingo and is inside the same plaza as BabyStacks.  There is a decent amount of sitting and prices were reasonable with most dishes being under $10.  This location closes on Mondays while the other on Decatur Blvd closes on Sundays.

Needless to say, this place is on my must go to eats list in Vegas!

Calamari taco and Tacodilla are outstanding!  For such a reasonable price and delightful personalized service, it might just be the best meal deal in Vegas.   What a great idea.  We need one of these in Phoenix!

My wife and I got takeout from Komex and they were nice enough to make our order even though we arrived a couple minutes after closing. The food was delicious and what I was hoping from a Korean/Mexican place at a very reasonable price. 

My only complaint is that the menu is a little hard to read since all of the items start with the word Fusion. I get that it is the brand and all, but it is hard to scan a menu when everything starts with Fusion.

I hate hate hate fusion places but my girlfriend wanted to try this place out so I agreed. Why do I hate fusion? I'm a firm believer in foods tasting better as they were intended to be eaten, and boy was I right about KoMex.

Arrived to a empty restaurant wandering around looking lost for any sign of life to be seated, few minutes later a lady popped her head out of a curtain asking if we would like to be seated, 'um yes?' We decided our order through the pictures already pointed out on yelp and ordered the Bulgogi Fries, Chicken Fusion Burrito to share. The chicken burrito was tasty 4/5 but the Bulgogi fries were soggy and didn't scream fresh ingredients in any way. Had mushy salty pickled jalape√±os I would love to have seen some fresh on it and it was drenched in some liquid that tasted like sugar water. Maybe a double fry on the fries to combat this issue? Idk it just wasn't for me and while the chicken burrito was decent I don't think I would go out of my way for it. Service is nonexistent but this might be due to no patrons and having only one girl run the whole operations. It is fairly cheap $20 for two $15.81(food)  $4.19 (tip).

Just had todays special, Bulgogi grilled cheese. Delicious blend of spicy beef with the comfort food grilled cheese was a perfect mix. I got the sweet potato fries too, they were thin, crispy and delicious.

This place is absolutely awesome. While the service was a little slow, I'll cut them a lot of slack on that because:

- there was a group of like 30 people that had started arriving a few minutes before us and was still arriving after we were seated

- the waitress was really nice, and very attentive when not dealing with said large group

- service was only a little slow despite staff being clearly overwhelmed

- food arrived promptly and hadn't been sitting under a heat lamp

So, beyond that, the food was absolutely delicious. I had the Daeji bulgogi burrito (pork fusion burrito). My friend had the fusion tostada (pork) and an order of wings. Neither of us was able to finish what we ordered, but we both really wished we could, because it was sooooo delicious. 

Total damage for all that (plus he had a large Hite beer and my Iced tea) was around $35, so two good meals here for about the price of one not so great meal at El Burro Burracho.

If you're at the Rio or even a bit further, this place is well worth the Lyft fare.

Love this place and is now one of my favorites! Had three different tacos, Kimchi fried rice, Bulgogi burrito, and chicken wings. All was so delicious! This location is more of a sit down style restaurant. Weird that the men's one person bathroom has a big gap in the door. It would suck if you had to go #2.
Our whole experience was wonderful- from the service (quick and our waitress was lovely) to the delicious food to the ambiance- this place is a little gem! Will definitely be returning.

Took some friends here that was visiting.  This place puts vegas to shame!  Decor and customer service at its worst!  The food was eh ok I rather spend my money on either a korean bbq joint or going to a Mexican restaurant.
Best food I had for a long time. Good portion, with that little spice that make it taste perfect.

This is my favorite fusion food diner. The service is great, food is amazing, and the atmosphere is a thumbs up. Its a small chain but has a bright future ahead of them. My friends and family love this place also! I recommend the fusion burrito, fusion nachos, and/or the bulgogi cheesesteak  sandwich. It is a little greasy but I'm here for a good time, not a long time!

Have you ever thought about getting bulgogi Korean beef and putting it in a nice soft tortilla taco with a splash of pico de gallo and kimchi? This restaurant did it perfectly. There's nothing like getting down and dirty with these tacos if you know what I mean. But seriously, one bite you can taste two different countries South Korea and Mexico. The beef is cooked just right, when the beef hits you  it that bam feeling like a A-rod hitting a homer, then the pico gives you that tropical feeling as if you were on the beach in cabo, don't forget to add lime to get that sprite going, and of course the kimchi that will really take you back to your roots. Great place to eat!

I ordered the Fusion Tostada because it was what was featured in the TV program, and I also got the beef taco on lettuce wrap, thinking the fusion tostada would not be enough.

The fusion tostada was a whole lot of food, and it tasted so much better than I anticipated.  A truly amazing fusion of tastes from many cultures.

The beef taco on lettuce was a wonderful discovery.  I thought it could have been the one featured on the show.

Each of the dishes can be a meal by itself for lightweight eaters.

The food here is amazing.  I love Mexican and Korean food, so the combination hits me in all the right places. The prices are very reasonable, and I would definitely recommend this to all my friends and family. My personal favorite is the spicy pork fushion burritos.  Portions are huge, so come hungry.

I am an addict. They opened komex across the street from me and I started out on the pork belly tacos, the bulgogi burritos, and the chimichangas, but I have escalated to a full-blown fried rice addiction. their pork fried rice is some of the best fried rice I've ever eaten, I don't know if it's the sesame oil, or copious amounts of crack cocaine. But I eat the fried rice at least once a week

I love me some Mexican food. I enjoy myself some Korean food. Fusing them together? 

Skeptical at first, now I'm a believer. This is good. 

This brings together the best of both worlds. You get the spices and the heat from the Mexican food and you get freshness and crunch from the Korean food. 

I opted for the Bulgogi rice bowl with kim chi / lettuce / jalapenos / white rice and, of course, bulgogi. The freshness of the kim chi and lettuce paired well with the heat of the jalepenos. This bowl is also huge. I came in with an appetite and I couldn't finish the whole thing. Another plus is that the service is very friendly. 

One note I found though. There was also soy sauce in the rice bowl. Soy sauce is fantastic but too much of it is miserable. Especially if there are these Mexican flavors in there as well. You should take advice from John Dies at the End and lay off the soy sauce. 

Definitely will have to experience more of this fusion.

I've always heard about this place but never tried it until today. Service was fast and prompt. We went around lunch time and there was only one customer. 

My friends and I ordered multiple items, mostly from recommendations off of other Yelp reviews. I ordered the beef kimchi fried rice and a pork bulgogi fusion taco. My friend ordered a beef bulgogi fusion burrito and my other friend ordered a chicken enchilada plate. 

Surprisingly, the best dish out of everything we ordered was the chicken enchilada plate. It was the tastiest and the most memorable dish. Definitely worth trying.

The pork bulgogi fusion taco was delicious! I honestly can't wait to try the other meats.

The beef bulgogi burrito was... okay. Mediocre. Nothing significant about it.

The most disappointing dish, unfortunately, was the kimchi fried rice. I don't know if we just chose the wrong meat to go with it, but it was not the best. Good spice level and the full size was a good portion. Taste wise, it was okay but it did not wow us. 

Overall, this place was good. There's a lot to choose from and it's decently priced.

First off, for what you pay, portion is way generous.  Pregnant wife ask if it will be enough to fill her... yup! She said she is way full. 

Fusion done right! Taste so good!!

I ordered togo but wait wasn't long. Plenty of seating for group. 

Bathroom was clean too.

I'm telling you, generous portions. 

Ordered: full bulgogi plate, beef flautas, half order season cheese fries w chicken

My family loves this place.   I have tried everything and loved it all.   Linda is so nice and the other staff are very polite.   This week we came in 3 times!  My kids get the regular Mexican style and I have to tell you that's really good too.   We love places that take care to make good food!!  If it looks not so busy in here, it's because they do a lot of business by take out.:.

Had read a review for this place in a magazine, and since I love Korean food, my hubbs and I decided to check it out.  Of course I had a sinus inf when we went so I really couldn't taste the food.  I got the bulgogi plate.  I liked it, I should have ordered the kimchi as well but I didn't :(

Hubbs got the fusion fries/nacho plate combo with bulgogi meat.  It was really good.  The complimentary chips and salsa/guacamole was really delicious!

Of course the service was good.  Everyone was really nice.

I've been to their other location a handful of times and love it every time I go there. But since I was closer to this location, I decided to give it a try.

The food is the same. Its always just as delicious, but the reason for this two stars was the service. The waitress made it such a bad experience. 

She had an attitude the whole time! From the minute we stepped in, she wasnt even welcoming. She had zero patience for us when we were deciding on chicken or beef (a 30 second discussion). She only refilled our waters once while there were only two other tables here. Not even a smile from this lady!

I love KoMex and I will continue to go, but definitely not this location.

Great and cheap food the pork belly taco is just fantastic
Very good fried rice 
The service is very fast
My husband and I really enjoyed the food here. My husband got the bulgogi tacos, and I got the bulgogi grilled cheese. Very chill atmosphere, will defiantly come back again!
Really good food and nice prices! The bulgogi tots are to die for and the fusion wings had a great flavor to them. I highly recommend this place!

Last night..... my husband and I tried out this restaurant for the first time. The spicy pork on the crispy rice tostada with their hot sauces mixed together is so good. Their Korean spiced wings, beef bulgogi plate, and the apple Soju were tasty too! We also had the beef bulgogi tacos which were average and the shrimp flautas were rather plain tasting and a little too greasy inside. They have beer, wine, and several flavors of Jarritos mexican sodas. We arrived an hour before their last seating but service was quick, informative, friendly, and very accommodating . We will definitely return.

Thinking of Komex, all i have to say is, "GET IN MY BELLLAYYY!" Everything literally sounds good. Everything is a punch of flavors and an amazing fusion of food blending korean flavors with Mexican touches that literally pair so well together.

I am in love with nachos. And my friend loves fries. The perfect solution? Komex half fries half nachos platter. Delicious. I ended up actually loving the fries more and my friend loved the chips better. How ironic? You get to choose your meat (beef bulgogi, pork bulgogi, chicken or they have tofu and  pork belly). The beef was the best option in my opinion for the nachos and fries. It really needed a sweet and bold flavor and this hit the money mark. Do come hungry because it is so much food we couldn't even finish this dish.

We also tried the pork belly on a stick which was good (korean bulgogi flavor) but it did need something like rice to cut the fat.

The torta was also drool-drenching worthy. Love torta rolls because they just soak up all the goodies and melt in your mouth. I definitely recommend that. We also had to try the korean hot wings. Sticky icky yasss! Love the blend of sweetness and korean chilli, however I could have done with more spice, salt and some kind of vinegar to balance it. Nonetheless it was really flavorful and I wish I could have ate it all. Perfectly fried, crispy, and just so flavorful.

The pork taco ($2) was just okay to me. My only gripe is that the marinades were the same. Same for the pork belly stick and tacos. I wish there were some differences between certain meats to really balance out dishes. But I mean overall, the food is really good and truly blends foods I normally crave for into one dish. I would come back and eat it again and try other dishes like the kimchi fried rice or the flautas or burritos. 

Definitely worth it! Wonderful, attentive, and super friendly service. Ample parking and seating! Prices range from $2 (small bites) to $8 nachos or $6 tortas and the list goes on. Definitely will fill u up and make you wanna roll out of the restaurant and take a nap!

Gross. This is not fusion.  This is like "hey, your Korean condiments got in my Mexican food".  When we got there the place was empty.  The Server was not in the best of moods  she was NOT helpful with suggestions from the menu.  The food was gross. They served chips but gave us(group of five) one tiny basket to share with one tablespoon of Pico Dee Gallo....no offer to fill the chips. The Ambiance was not impressive..old walls covered with a bad paint job. I will not be returning or suggesting this place to anyone. I love Mexican food and I love Korean food so I can't even say how disappointing this place was.

Great, unique and flavorful dishes! Family owned business so you always get fast, friendly and personable service with a smile. Portions are HUGE! Every time I go I always order too much because their portions are so generous, great vegan options as well! Love this place

3.5 stars 

So I gave Komex 2 chances. The first
time I loved the nachos! My husband ESP loved it for their "fluffy airy" chips but the flavors were pretty delicious. The pork burrito was good but it was too spicy for this wuss. The chow fettuccine was yuck in my opinion. I like more noodles than veggies/meat and the ratio of meat and veggies was about 2:1 noodles. The noodles were all broken and I noticed in other pictures that's just the way it's made? I decided I would go back though after that...

My second visit we got the nachos again and I wanted to try the musubi and shrimp taco. Musubi was just your average musubi. The shrimp taco was soggy but that's what happens when you get it to go. Maybe if I had asked for the pico on the side it would have helped but I wasn't impressed this go around. 

I had some qualms about fusion food as other fusion places I didn't care for either. I like that it's fairly quick, but maybe I'm just too old school for the fusioness scene.

No joke, I was skeptical. (yes i thought you would laugh at I was skeptical). But the way they do meat here... good Lord I could just eat the meat by itself and that is exactly what I did.

So tender and juicy with delicious spices and made with a lot of love. I tried my buddies burrito and my other friends taco and they do a great job of mixing the meat with burrito. '

If you get spicy pork I suggest getting a little lettuce with it because it is refreshing and really pairs well with all their meat.

Spicy pork and bulgogi. I have nothing else to say really, I really enjoyed it and it is perfect for a lunch break.

THE VERDICT: Go here. It is great food at a reasonable price and it is quick and easy. Everything is easy to share, and even easier to keep to yourself. Because you are worth it, and deserve a break.

Considering how picky I am about the authenticity of the Mexican Food I eat, and the fact that my wife is Korean, we were hoping we had found a place that would please the two of us.

Chic Fil A only serves Chicken, In 'n Out, is known for it's great hamburgers, Pinks only serves hot dogs. What's my point? If you do something well, concentrate on that specialty, and do it well. 

I ordered a Chimichonga, and at the server's suggestion, with beef bulgogi. It was a generous portion, and the flavor was decent. But it lacked the flavor of the ones that I enjoyed at a pure Mexican establishment. 

My wife ordered Kimchi fried rice, the standard for any Korean eating establishment. She was not pleased. She boxed up 95% of it, and we fed it to my under employed, and financially struggling Son, who was hungry. 

Interestingly enough, my Korean wife, who really doesn't care for Mexican food, ended up eating a sizable portion of my Chimichonga, and enjoyed it more than the pure Korean food.

The service is good, and prices are very reasonable. It's just that if I want Mexican Food, I will go to a Mexican establishment, that can be considered reasonably authentic. If I want Korean food, I need only ask my wife "what's for dinner?"

I was skeptical of this mash-up, but I liked it. 

Came in here close to closing to eat some dinner. I ordered the bulogigi chimichanga. Mmmmm-hmmm. 

I can see that it can be a little off-putting to have the sweetness of some Korean dishes when you are do not usually find that in Mexican dishes. But it ended up working. Partly because I added some extra heat to balance out the sweetness. I pretty piled on all of the sauces that they had and experimented with different combinations. 

The lady that sever us was super sweet. I will be back when I am on this side of town!

I'm going to be a bit of a party pooper, but I wasn't ecstatic to eat here since I've had food at their other location prior. I was hopeful that spring valley would be different. 

Bulgogi burrito- 3 stars. It was the size of my face, but I just think that I'm not a huge fan of the fusion Korean/Mexican food. I LOVE Mexican food, and something about the bulgogi just didn't do it for me. 

Bulgogi rice bowl- 3 stars. This was okay for me as well. I didn't quite get what was the big deal. I'd rather go eat a bibimbap. 

Pork bulgogi tater tots- 4 stars. How the hell did that happen you ask? I love nachos, and sour cream. This was a spin off of it, hence I loved it. I really think it was the sour cream though. My friend swapped the bulgogi for pork bulgogi, which was a good choice. 

Pork belly skewers- 2 stars. I didn't like the pork belly quality or the marinade. 

Interior is a bit "hole in the wall." They serve alcohol, accommodates bigger parties, but the place is not all that huge. Service was 5 stars. They were very organized, able to do separate checks for a party 16 people.

The cleaner, brighter location with food just as good. Komex was a huge hit a couple of years back and they haven't changed. They have a pretty large size bar with a single tv at this location, but it definitely doesn't have a bar feel. I guess it makes the restaurant friendly to solo attendees? 
We ordered the beef burrito. Bulgogi style with beef of course- forget the other meats. The burrito was bigger than your average Chipotle burrito. Really, really filling.
I love eating here when I visit Vegas! Food is generally cheap and yummy. The bulgogi tacos are awesome. Ask for kimchi for extra spice and flavor. The nacho fries were delicious too!

Sweet staff, delicious fusion food, and bang for your buck! We tried the chips/fries nacho combo, a calamari taco, a pork belly taco, and a pork chimichanga. All so flavorful and unlike anything we've ever had. Will definitely be coming back!

Bulgogi Fusion Fries, Kimchi Fried Rice and some delicious grilled meats on a stick ( chicken, beef & pork belly). Everything was absolutely delicious!  Much nicer interior compared to the older location too. We will definitely be regulars here

This place blew me away! The sauce tray of 4 different flavors compliments their food so well. I had chicken fusion enchiladas they were so flavorful and went really well with the hot sauce with kimchi. Talk about comfort food...my husband had loco moco that had an amazing homemade gravy sauce. I will be back many times over. If it was closer to my neighborhood I would be here every day - it's addicting:)
Amazing fusion food with great sides and sauces. I'm a fan of their slaw and the flautas!

Love this place & it's sister location on Decatur/ Washington...
They have great Korean/Mexican fusion dishes at a very good price.
Every visit, has had great, polite service.
This location seems to be a little larger than the other, but seating is limited.
This is not fast food! I Was told every dish is made to order, so it takes a sec, but so well worth it.

Add kimchi to your tacos or burrito for a special kick!!

The kimchi fried rice is outstanding...rivals an Korean place we have been to.
Awesome food! Nachos and fries were more than enough for two people. Bulgolgi beef is tasty. All the ingredients are fresh. The Kimchi fried rice is excellent! I will definitely come back again!
Some pretty interesting food here, a fusion of Mexican and Korean BBQ. Nothing fancy but good food.

I had to check out KoMex Fusion restaurant that was featured on BuzzFeed. Check out the Youtube video (https://youtu.be/tCqu3dxm56g). I literally had to try everything they ate on the featured video. I have to agree, GREAT HANGOVER FOOD! Decently size portion and prices for what you get! 

I tried the following: 
+  1/2NACHO- 1/2FRY COMBO with Chicken with Mozzarella Cheese, Pico de Gallo, Jalapeno & Korean Hot Sauce = was nice to start of with something crunchy and spicy. A great appetizer to share with your friends. I would get this again. 
+ Bulgogi Tater Tots = Tater tots with cheese, bulgogi, sour cream, pork belly, bacon, and tomato. It is golden, perfect, and just the perfect amount of crunch.
+ Fusion Chimichanga with Beef = with Mexican Rice and Cheese inside. That is topped with Enchilada Sauce, Cheese, KoMex Slaw and Pico de Gallo. IS TO DIE FOR! I could eat this over and over again!
+ KimChi Fried Rice with Spam with Sunnyside up Egg on top = I love the kick of spice. but it's not too spicy. You cannot go wrong with this.

It's filling and good for the price. Something about it, though, makes it not that memorable for me. It's just meh. I feel like I need to pile on their sauces on the food for a kick, but even the sauces are forgettable to me. The bulgogi BEEF meat is well seasoned. Can't say the same for chicken. 
It is set at a pretty decent price. For about $8 you can get a big meal. A whole order of bulgogi fries could really feed two. $4 for two spam musubis. $2 tacos. I've had the chimichanga and burrito and nachos as well, which I think I may pass next time.
Complimentary chips, salsa, & guac. I enjoy the complimentary oranges at the end.

Yum! Came here for a team outing and everything was delish! The portions are HUGE and the prices are great! I went there with 6 other people and our total bill, including two appetizers and beverages, was $123 including a 20% gratuity for a large group. I've been wanting to go here for a while and regret I didn't come sooner. There's a smaller one closer to my house so I'll definitely plan to go there in the very near future.
