Ewww never again. Owner is nice. But some things should just not be mixed like Mexican and Korean food.

Experience:  I came with some friends to try out the fusion.   I have wanted to try this place for almost a year.  Maybe sometimes that wait sets your expectations to high. It was decent, but not as good as I tasted it in my mind. 

Food: they put chips and salsa on the table that were okay, but definitely not my go to Mexican choice. 
I ordered 3 tacos which had your choice of meat...I picked the Bulgogi (Beef), Daeji bulgogi (Pork) and Pork Belly.  All there were good, but not amazing. 
My friend ordered the Kimchi fried rice.  It was a HUGE portion.  It was pretty tasty.
Another friend ordered the bulgogi nachos that I tried, which were pretty disappointing. Even he was regretful at his order. 

Service:  the service was not too great.  I had to get up and find the waitress to get a beer. She was pretty slow to take our food order too.  It was a little busy, so that might have been the issue, but this is never an excuse as the management should staff better. 

Facility:  it's pretty small, but comfortable enough for this casual cuisine. 

Overall review:  it was ok.  I would probably come back with friends, but not at my suggestion.

Oh my goodness, I've found a new favorite place! 

Hubby was in the mood for Mexican and suggested the usual suspects. But I wanted something new and exciting! I also wanted something casual and affordable. Based on their website, this place fit the bill. And they didn't disappoint!

We visited around 6p on a Wednesday evening. There was only one other full table when we arrived and it didn't get any busier throughout our stay. 

The front of the menu listed their specials and the loaded Tots immediately caught my eye. They also do a loaded nacho/fry which comes in small or large. But that only comes with one meat. These Tots came in one size and was loaded with THREE meats - bulgogi, bacon and pork Belly! Woah!! Need I say more? It was fantastic! Hubby and I are pigs, so we definitely could've used a bigger size portion. But it ended helping us save room so we could try a few more items. 

Hubby couldn't resist some tacos, so we went with one calamari and one pork Belly. He was pretty crazy about the former. It was definitely bigger and packed full of more food than most of these Gourmet tacos that are so popular nowadays.

Next we went for the Bulgogi Tortas. They take a patty of white rice, deep fry it and cover it with meat and vegetable goodness! The outside of the rice patty was crispy, while the inside was soft and perfectly soaked up all the juices from the meat. Apparently this dish was featured on a Food Network show. And I can see why - it is unique and delicious!

We were nearing the point of being full, but everything was so good that we just had to try one more! Because I love cheese, we chose the Bulgogi Empanadas. The cheese was melted to perfect ooey Gooey-ness. And the tortilla it was wrapped it was one of the most amazing things I've ever had! It had a very light crisp on the outside and the inside was fluffy - not over-fried and dried. 

When our waitress brought the bill, she also brought a complimentary dessert of half an orange! How refreshing. 

My one and only complaint - they advertise that if you pay with cash you get 5% off. But for some reason we didn't get it....

We can't wait to go back to this place! Those oases Tots and the empanadas need to happen again. And maybe something new like the bacon fried rice?

Food is delicious! Served fresh and hot! The bulgogi fries are delicious, especially when accompanied by the house's homemade kim chee! I worked in Austin for years and ate at the Chilantro truck as often as I could. No contest, Komex wins hands down!

I've tried another Korean-Mexican place in L.A. and had the runs, but the adventurous part of me still wanted to give this classification of cuisine another shot. I went with family and was thoroughly impressed. The tacos had the right texture and aroma with the tortilla, and the burrito was well done. Though the beef bulgogi was on the sweet side just a bit. It worked well with the burrito, but not so much the enchilada. Staff was friendly, and the toothpicks for the oranges were cute. The men's bathroom was clean, though it was intimidating seeing a poster of the godfather woke I was peeing. I highly recommend!

FINALLY, I got the chance to try KoMex.  I hadn't known that they had one near my work, so I was exciiiited.  My hubs has been wanting me to try this place for the longest.  He works up North, but we live on the opposite side of town so I never agreed to going there until we were on that side of town.  Well that never came around, but here I am at their other location.  We came right when they opened and I have to say that this restaurant gets really busy.  So if you are in a rush, they even put a sign up saying that there will be a wait.  

Well I had every intention of trying one of their fusion Tacos or Burritos, but I basically had my mind set when I saw the Bulgogi plate.  I was so thankful that they brought us chips, salsa, and guacamole.  I was so hungry.  Guacamole was awesome!  On to my main dish.  

Can I tell you that I was impressed?  I would be the type to try what their best known for, but I went on a limb and just did Korean.  The bulgogi is flavored right, the fried rice is a great option to compliment your choice of protein, and if you think thats too much carbs and protein you can add on veggies which is what I did.  Oh, the hot sauce, on point!  I'm pretty sure its made there.  It has a really nice kick to it.  

I want to return and try their bulgogi fries and a burrito, however, I'll need my husband to assist on finishing their large portions.  LOL!

My husband and I stumbled upon this place while having breakfast at Babystacks and decided to come here the day after for lunch before heading back home to CA. I ordered the bulgogi cheesesteak sandwich with fries and he ordered the pork belly burrito. Neither one of us finished our food and had to take it home. The meat serving was very generous and the quality of the food was good. I'm glad we decided to come here and we'll probably be stopping by again next time we're in town. The host was very nice you get 5% off your bill when you pay cash. This place is about 10 mins away from the strip but worth the drive.

Amazing! Blending Korean and Mexican cuisine is genius! The environment is super casual and the food is out of this world.  I went with a group of friends and we started with the Bulgogi nachos. We each ordered something different, burrito with spicy pork, tostado with bulgogi with their special komex slaw and a crispy rice patty, chicken and bulgogi tacos with corn tortillas, and bulgoi and pork belly lettuce wrap tacos. 

Everything was excellent. I wish I was a local so that I can eat here more often.

It's a rather small place and I can see that this place gets packed quickly. I would recommend this place to anyone whobwants good quality food that is reasonably priced.

This place is okay if you go in with the expectation that you'll be getting fast food that you can't really buy anywhere else. As for the quality, everything was extremely greasy.

We got the fettuccine noodles, a cheesesteak sandwich, and a bulgogi plate.  Each item was greasier than the last.

We saw the reviews and were really excited to try this place but it was a let down.  The price is what makes this a three. Otherwise the food alone was probably a 2 to 2 1/2 stars.
Thank god they opened one on the sw part of town. We love everything on the menu! We usually get the taco w kimchi on the side, and the spam fried rice.

This place was delicious!! The bulgogi tots were amazing! Loved the crunchy tots with the cheese, bacon, pork belly, and bulgogi. One bite and I was hooked! I also ordered their meat combo rice place. The meat seasoning was great and it was so good. I highly recommend this place for anyone. Extremely happy my friend referred me to this place since I was in Vegas for the weekend. The service is great as well.
Indeed the best fusion food I've ever had! The flavors mix so well together. Amazing! The fusion tacos and fusion nachos are a MUST!

Love this place! Fusion mixed Korean and Mexican dishes. My favorite is the Bulgogi Beef Tater Tot hot skillet! Melted cheesy goodness inside. Topped with; sour cream, bacon, tomatoes, and green onions. Complimentary chips with salsa and guacamole are included with each dish. And their variety of hot sauces are excellent.

Nice little place to drink and eat some very good food. They have a bar and regular seating. Mostly Mexican beer except Hite which is from Korea. Overall clean and orderly. Great service. For most of the time I was there there was only one waitress but she was flying around was a smile on her face. Food? Wonderful! I had a beef bulgogi burrito and a bulgogi taco. My buddy had chicken bulgogi with rice. Both were great but the burrito stood out. At the table next to us the lady ordered the breakfast burrito that she lived. Great place and I'll be back.

At first, I was a little skeptical if this place would as good as the original location as with most restaurants who scale. Well, it is....It is the same quality as the original. As usual, the Komex tacos were great along with the kimchi fried rice with three meats. The service is always friendly and attentive. Good job Komex!

What a pleasant experience. Greeted by a very polite and friendly person. I ordered some fusion tacos(beef), and kimchi fried rice.  The only problem with the food was it is so good I find it hard to stop eating.  This is a must have food in Vegas.
I was craving Korean tacos and this place was recommended on Yelp, and it was more than satisfying. I ordered the beef tacos and some fusion tacos and I am so happy. I highly recommend this place.

We've eaten here before multiple times and the food is really good and different. The Bulgogi fries and the flautAs are my favorites only thing bad is the wait times for food can be pretty long at times. 
Today however our food came quickly and was delicious flautAs, sliders, and a mini quesadilla. Definitely need a kids menu here though.

Was too busy enjoying the food to take pictures, but the bulgogi grilled cheese was amazing, so were the fusion tacos!
On top of that the prices are really affordable!
Wings, nachos, tacos, burritos, taters, and fries. Pick your enjoyment and be absorbed in a new culture of food. Portions are large and dripping with goodness. The service was great!

After wanting to try this place out for the longest time, it was a huge disappointment. I had the bulgogi fusion burrito. It was not good. Everything inside lacked flavor. It was very bland. Inside the burrito consisted of rice, bulgogi, lettuce and pico de gallo. I even tried their salsa they gave me with the burrito which didn't help with the blandness. 

Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but it was disappointing. I may try giving it a second chance in the future.

I had the burritos and tried their tacos. It's really good Korean bbq meats
that are paired as a burrito or taco. I think they have bowls as well.

The quality of meat matters a lot to me, and they did well in that department.
The condiments and spices were interesting and definitely enhanced the meal
even more. This place is a winner in my book.

I've only been here a couple of times and the workers have always been nice. They check up on you when you're dining in. They're a pleasure to talk to when you're ordering for take out. 

The kimchi fried rice is really good! I ordered half & it was so hard to finish. I can't imagine getting the full order! Their guacamole is good too! It doesn't taste like its the prepackaged ones but fresh vegetables. Their bulgogi fries are also super good. I haven't tried a lot of things on the menu but I've heard a lot of good things so I'll have to come back & try something new!

WOW!!!! LIP SMACKING GOOD!!!!! This is not your standard Mexi-joint. If that's what you want they have that too but come for the Mexi-Korean fusion. My husband and I both had the chimichanga. I had the beef, which is the most popular. The taste of the Korean bbq spices in the burrito was heavenly. It was also HUGE!  Very generous portions. My husband had the spicy pork and he was so quite as he devoured his. Both of us could not finish it all. I'm so happy i have some for dinner or lunch tomorrow. Do yourself a favor and come try the fusion. You won't regret it.
I always get kimchi fried rice from here and it's fabulous. Sometimes I get their pork belly tacos and they are super good.

Komex is one of those places where a little goes a long way.  $10 gets you a lot of food, and the food is good.  The food is also consistent, with this location serving the same dishes with the same flavors as the original spot.

I've stuck with their fusion offerings, since fusion is in the restaurant name.  The tacos, tostadas, and flautas are my go to dishes.  Taking this style of food and using Korean style meats works out quite well, with the pork being my favorite meat.  Service is friendly and food has always been fresh.  With the larger restaurant space, this location is a great place to stop by for a quick lunch or small dinner at a good price.

Fusion Mexican and Korean? Yes please. Everything was amazing!!! The tostada, tarot toys, chimichanga....amazing. Bulgogi beef for miles! 

The shrimp taco was good, but didn't compare.

Very strip mall so don't expect fancy, but come for the food!

We originally planned to go to the other location but that one is closed on Sundays. Good thing we came to this location because they have special bar menu items that are not available at the other one. Let's just say the bulgogi burrito and grilled cheese are two MUST tries. I'm sure everything with beef in it will be good since they marinate their bulgogi very well. We tried the chicken with quesataco and it was good but nothing special. Chicken is tender and the flavor is average, however this is probably one of the healthier tasting item we ordered. We also tried bulgogi half fries and half nachos. I personally don't think getting the nacho was a good idea because they give you free chips so if you really wanted to you could just mix that in with the fries. But overall that dish was okay. The flavoring wasn't as good as the rest of items we tried and it probably will never order this again now that I know what it taste like. There are still some items on the menu that we would love to try but didn't get a chance to. Definitely will be back again next time we are in the area.

This place is wonderful from start to finish. When I walked in I was greeted with a warm smile and was told I could sit wherever. I was the only person there so I grabbed a seat in front of the TV. It was 5:58pm and the nice lady quickly grabbed me a beer so I could get the happy hour price that ended at 6pm. How cool is that?

I loved the chips, salsa and guac I was brought. Everything was fresh. I ordered the beef fusion burrito. I'm not a fan of lettuce in burritos (gets too soggy) so I asked for Korean slaw instead and it was wonderful. It kept a nice crunch. All the flavors combined, sweet Korean flavored meat and spice from the rice, was amazing. I couldn't even finish half the burrito. I ordered the kimchi fried rice to-go. I'm way too full to eat it. It looks and smells amazing. That will be my meal tomorrow for sure. Yum!
Really good food mixing Mexican and Korean food style together! Gotta try the lettuce pork belly wrap!! Really affordable and the service was great considering there was only 2 people working

Delicious! Great customer service and speed in delivering items. They did a great job making recommendations based on my food allergies (celiac disease-no gluten!) I ordered tacos in lettuce cups and they were delicious. My favorite were the beef tacos!!!

Like most places in Vegas, KoMex is in a random little strip mall. We ordered the tacos, bulgogi burrito, and fettuccine chow mein. All of them were good, but nothing blew my mind. 

The tacos were probably my first choice of what I would order if I were to go back.
The burrito second. It was good, but the bulgogi wasn't as flavorful and wasn't nearly as saucy as I was expecting.
The noodles (to me) were the most disappointing, so we took these to go after our meal. I personally thought these tasted better as leftovers.

I do like the complimentary chips & salsa (though this is purely mexican and not korean at all)

KoMex has a great concept going, but I believe that their large menu leaves a lot of room for improvement. I'd like to see them narrow down the items they offer, and improve on those.

it's now my favorite cheap food place in las vegas! 
This is the perfect korean mexican fusion place. 
I always get the bulgogi bowl. It comes with rice, veggies, kimchi, lots of bulgogi and a special chili pepper sauce with mmm egg and sesame oil on top. The portions are huge so you can always have yummy left overs. 
The wonton soup is super yummy here too but that is the only thing they say they put MSG on. But it is still super delicious. 
The best part is they offer FREE chips with guac and salsa! They always have great service too! 
this place is about 5 miles off the strip but if you want affordable and large portions, go here!

Man oh man. This place is amazing. If anyone is looking for some Asian fusion this place will hit the spot. I came in here around 9. It was pretty quiet and  we got seated immediately and ordered right away. Here's the stuff we ordered;
Bulgogi tator tots: with bacon bits, sour cream, tomatoes, green onions, and topped with delicious melted cheese. 5/5. This was a special on one of the menus so look/ask for it because it's a must have! 

Kimchi fried rice: with pork belly and topped with a yolky egg. The best kimchi fried rice I've had in Vegas. So flavorful and the kimchi was perfect. Some places don't have good kimchi.. But man, it was on point. 5/5

Korean chicken wings: bold flavor and sweet and tangy at the same time. They were really delicious as well, but I've had better Korean wings at some other joints. 4/5. 

Service was amazing as well! Water was never empty. The owner even came out to make sure everything was okay. At the end our server also boxed our leftover food for us. (they serve huge portions here) 
I will definitely be coming back. I want to try those tacos so bad!

Had komex for dinner tonight and it was pretty good! The waitress was very nice!! She was the only one I saw working and she handled everything like a pro! Food had a lot of flavor and prices were reasonable!

Komex is great; great food, great people, great prices, good location...I am always happy I chose to put their food in my belly and my money in their till. 

Their menu is just the right size; big enough you can try a few different things, although why would you do that, Bulgogi Tacos are where it's at, and ---oh, you're gluten free? Well those come in lettuce wraps. And your friend is a pescatarian? Well we can do those with shrimp? Both of those people are in your same group? No worries, is there anything else we can get for you?

The owners are amazingly kind, and I've run into them a few times without realizing. Food in the restaurant is as awesome as takeout, as long as you don't wait forever to eat your takeout. This is the sort of local gem that everyone secretly hopes gets discovered so the owners can have a million billion dollars and hopes never ever gets discovered so it never changes. 

Komex soars in the intersection of the cuisines; spice and texture. The korean slaw, crisp and salty and vinegary, playing off against the beefy spiciness of the bulgogi, and the spice of the korea-mexican red...stuff. We'll call it salsa. All in a taco shell or lettuce cup while the juice spills down your fingers...Get the fusion stuff, and step up your usual spice level, and you'll get what the "deal" is. 

Pros;
- Great food, people, prices, and locale.
- Easy parking.
- Open pretty darn late.
- Easy takeout.
- They really make it easy for you to give them your money. Never any complaints about splitting checks, half cash half card, debit cards.

Cons;
- Con....con...con...The chimichanga was my least favorite of the things I ate there? It got pretty soggy halfway through. But I'm pretty sure that's inherent to chimichangas.
- This is sort of my Yelp mantra, but Know What You're In For. If you order All the Wrong Things you will have a pretty "meh" experience.

this place is a hidden jewel in vegas! i kid you not. great fusion of korean and mexican foods. had the nachos and sliders and portions are amazing for its price. i actually wonder of they make profit when i see the portion of korean meat since it's expensive. anyhow, service was great and owner was really nice. wish they have one in cali!
Food is always delicious! Fresh and fast. We ordered the 3 meat plate, a burrito, and our favorite is the hash brown fusion plate. I recommend for everyone to try those.
I come here when I crave Korean but can't afford to spend time in Chinatown.  Bulgogi torta!!!!!

My man and I were craving pupusas one day and I remembered while dropping off some dry cleaning that I saw a place next door.. Esmerelda's I think??? Well "Esmerelda's" is no longer there and Komex is and we could't be any more pleased. We had been wanting to try Komex for awhile but never found ourselves in the neighborhood of their original location... 

The interior is nothing special.. comparable to an upgraded Roberto's.. but the food mmm mmmm mmmm,,, There is now no reason to go to LA to get good Korean fusion tacos/burritos.. We ordered take out and as we took our first bite we knew that Komex was a winner... We ordered the bulgogi burrito with kimchi, kimchi fried rice with chicken and 3 different fusion tacos. Well, we halved the burrito, barely made a dent in the fried rice and couldn't even touch the tacos so that tells you a lil something something about the portions... The food was soooooo yumm and we will definitely be going back...

HOT TIP: get extra hot sauce... I believe it's made in-house and if you love garlic then you will LOVEEEE their hot sauce.. mmmm mmm MMM
I honestly hate Mexican food but the mix of Korean and mexican food it was honestly amazing. I would definitely come back again.
I love this place. I usually order Fusion chicken taco and Beef Bulgogi plate with Korean hot sauce. So good!!! I've been to the other location in the ghetto. Both locations great food and service.

Love this place  we ordered kimchi friedrice mix with 3 different meats .. beef, chicken and spam that's like $3 bucks more with full size .. and kalbi Stick 3 for  $7 bucks it tasted delish .. but disappointed they have Jarritos drink bottles except tamarind  that's the best one .. but overall tasty food no MSG that's a plus !!!

I love Mexican food and my wife loves Asian food. Lucky for us we have KoMex! Best of both worlds. Definitely have to try the spicy pork tacos with the fusion hot sauce. The beef is leagues above what you get from Roberto's or similar taco shops. They also have chips, salsa, and guacamole while you wait. Btw we had excellent service and the food was done within 5-10 minutes. My only suggestion would be to less oil in the cooking.
It definitely not what I expecting in a good way. They were able to combine Korean and Mexican food in a unique way, and was very good.

Awesome place!  Great food, very different, reasonably priced, good atmosphere.  Try the pork belly taco.  Plus the homemade salsas and guacamole are very good.  I love how close this place is to my house.  Plus they have the Mexican coke in the glass bottles!

Love the concept, pretty happy with some tacos, other dishes are pretty average. 

- chicken nachos, very meh, not sure if it's because nachos should never be made fusion style or the lack of the korean sauce ruined it. 
- Calamari tacos-- MEH, Do Not get.  Basically two fishstick like pieces of calamari with tartar sauce, Disgusting. 

Onto the good. 
- Fish taco is delectable. Very well seasoned and tasty. 


I've had shrimp and bulgogi at the other location and those did not disappoint, 

the Pork belly was average, nothing to write home about, not very flavorful, it sounds exotic, but it did not deliver.

Musubi w fried egg was ok. A tad on the salty side, and I would've liked more rice, but for 4$ for two giant pieces, I aint complaining.  Makes me miss Hawaii.

Went with a group of 4 and we tried a few different things.  I had Tofu Fried Rice with a side of Kimchi.  Was super tasty and big portion.  Others had Quesidilla & Tacos.  Everyone liked their meal.  Price was right, service was great, owner super friendly.

What more can I say, a solid option if you find your self in that part of town.  

Will definitely be back, planning to try their other location as well.

Komex opened up a secondary new location! It was not as busy as the original, though it's brand new and I wonder if people just don't know it's here. It's not far to head here though if the other one has a fairly long wait. 

We met up with our friends and shared a few items and got some individual tacos: 

Tacos - they now offer pork belly which was rather tasty and tender so I definitely recommend getting it on something with it. Also got daegi gogi/pork which is my other favorite taco. 

Pork Belly Fries - Lots of cheese, salsa, jalapenos and pork belly. Messy, but good and a large share- able portion.

Fusion Wings - This comes with plain fries and the wings were nicely crispy with a sticky sweet and spicy glaze. Really enjoyable as I have a little bit of a affinity for sweet and spicy wings.

Fusion Flautas - This is one of my favorite things to get. The flautas are crispy and yet fluffy fried tortilla stuffed with a good portion of meat and cheese. I enjoy the mix of guacamole with sweet Korean sauce they do. I love that there is more than enough for the flautas and extra always to dip chips in! 

Service was friendly enough. We had a second round of tacos and unfortunately it took long to get it. She did apologize and explain that a large party was before our order put in so not really their fault. 

The food taste the same, which is a good thing and I saw one of the owners here running the front so I'm glad they seem to be doing right with consistency of a second location. Will be back, it's not far from my work.

Love this place! Food is great! The owner is really nice! The restaurant is clean! 

Our first time at this restaurant. We were undecided on what to get. So I yelped some pictures. I was not disappointed at all! Had the Tacos (1 beef, 1 chicken, and 1 pork) I didnt know which one I liked the most.
The kids had musubi. My daughter can eat 2 normal sized Musubis but these were a whole nother caliber. For $4 you get 2 pieces but they were huge and my daughter couldnt finish the second piece. 
Also the Bulgogi Nachos were really good. We had a half order because they give you complimentary chips and salsa ... didnt want to over do it. Definitely a must try place... support your local ma&pa businesses!
Their bulgogi beef flautas and kimchi fried rice are amazing! Also very reasonable prices.

The original KoMex is about 1 mile closer to home but I opt to come here:
- Easy to get seating since it's a larger place.
- Beer is available.
- Same great food I've become addicted to.  
- For the price, KoMex is my favorite place to eat in Vegas.  I eat here at least twice a month.

We decided to throw my son's 1st communion reception at this Komex location and it was the best experience. You wouldn't think to throw a big group party here, but Linda and the staff made hosting my party of 40 people a breeze. Linda made the reservation and ordering process so simple. She answered EVERY question I had and made sure I was well taken care of throughout the whole party. The staff was so helpful and the food was fresh and ready to serve when I requested. They split my appetizers of bulgogi fries into proportionate servings so that I could spread it out amongst my guests and they set up a buffet-style area to serve the main dishes. They even allowed my to drop off my cake to hang on to until serving time and provided a knife and plates for that as well. I was worried about the expenses of drinks since they only sell by the can or bottle but they provided pitchers (actually fancy serving bottles) of filtered water to offset that cost tremendously and I just ordered non-water beverages for whoever wanted it. They set up the tables in rows so my party can all sit together, and they also covered the tables with tableclothes for a more elegant appeal. I also appreciated the complimentary salsa and chips to feed my guests until everyone arrived. Thank you all so much for such an amazing experience and I can't wait to go back!

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 19/100***

I called ahead to check if there was a wait for dinner, the lady said nope c'mon down. It was our first time at this location, this one is so much bigger so lesser wait time and doesn't feel like you're sitting on top of each other like their location on Decatur. 

There was only two other couple when we got there. Our server Linda told us to pick a spot and she'll be right with us. Within minutes she came back with the complimentary chips, salsa, guac and some water. She promptly returned with our drinks and then took our orders. We decided on kimchi fried rice, Korean wings, a pork belly taco and the surprisingly good bulgogi cheesesteak with fries. It was my first time trying the cheesesteak (thanks Ghia) and I think I've found my new favorite. It's so full of flavor with the perfectly marinated bulgogi, onions, peppers and oozing cheese. Not soon after, people started coming in as dinner rush was starting. 

Even though Linda was a one woman show, she handled herself well and still gave stellar service. This will be our chosen location as it's closer to home and a better dining experience altogether.

Based on the reviews of this place, I decided to try it out because I love fusion foods! My mom and I got the bulgogi rice bowl w/ fried rice, bulgogi chimichanga, and a side tater tots. We thought that the foods were a little heavy/salty for our taste buds unfortunately..  It sure was tasty but after a certain amount of time of digging in, the carbs and meat knocked us out to where we couldn't finish it. I definitely suggest that a main entree is shareable between two people. What I did absolutely love though were the tater tots! They were nice and crispy throughout our time. (:

This is probably the best lunch I've ever had. We tried Pork belly sticks and bulgogi quesadilla and will be back tomorrow for lunch. They give so much food for the price. Staff is so friendly and helpful for making suggestions.

Wow! This place exceeded my expectation! My husband and I came here for a quick meal before work. We came to this place because in a book called "4 hour chef" by Timothy Ferris. He rated best restaurants in the U.S and this was one of them. It was actually pretty good! My husband had the spicy pork plate, which he really enjoyed. I didn't try it because I can not stand spicy, haha. :D
I had 2 fish tacos, and it was soo good. The fish tasted so fresh and the balance of fish and cabbage and pico de gallo was perfect. 
We also had bulgogi nachos. Wow, so great! Give it a try! And very affordable!

We tried the tacos (Bulgogi, Pork Belly, and Calamari), KoMex Nachos w/KimChi, and Wonton soup. Everything was delicious and the meat was really cooked perfectly! There wasn't a bunch of fat on it and it wasn't rubbery or chewy. Their slaw they put on the tacos is kind of sweet and if you want hot sauce they bring you 4 types (2 Mexican and 2 Korean), though none of it is really that spicy. Food portions were decent and my wife and I ended up with take out after ordering only a half size nacho and soup to split with the tacos. Service was friendly and the price was reasonable. We will definitely be back.

So we stumbled in here because babystackz was super packed and we were starving. When we walked in we were able to pick wherever we wanted to seat and that was cool. Started looking over the menu and wasn't too sure if id like it here not. So I'll just go on to rate the food

Calamari tacos (4.5/5) kind of expecting squid with tentacles but nope just strips so probably frozen. But the flavors were so simple and tasted great.

Chimichanga with bulgogi beef (3.99/5) when I'm eating something with bulgogi I feel as if I'm exPecting the meat to totally blow my mind with bursting flavors but it wasn't as bulgogi as I expected. I'm not sure that makes sense but some of you that read this may know what I'm taking about. The Mexican part of this dish was very good and their salsas that you can put on this are all great

Pork belly musubis (5/5)- omg! This was probably my favorite thing here. it wasn't just covered with teriyaki sauce like most
places just to give the meat flavor cooked right the pork belly had the good crisp on it like bacon but I would like it a little more crisp. The coolest thing was our waitress did say I could add an egg on it and have like mini breakfast musubis so ill be back to try this for sure

Kimchi fried rice( 3/5) this dish needs some work so I don't have that much to say but the flavors need to be brought it with more vegetables that I feel were missing from a kimchi fried rice. I don't mind the soggy sometimes as long as fried rice has that little burnt taste like it was cooked on a hot wok but it wasn't there and too mushy.

Korean Chicken wings (3/5)-one of my favorite things if done right but some disappointing news for you here from me was the chicken was frozen and fried which made it hard. im very picky when it comes to chicken and yeah it didn't compare to the same wings from soyo or buldogis.

The prices and the service was good so we will definitely be back to try other things I just hope I can give my honest review first and maybe they can work on these things and ill enjoy the food more going forward.

It pains me to give my beloved komex three stars, but it's what I felt was deserved on my lunch here.

Overall the same yummy food. I mean seriously how they do make the perfect creation of fries each time I come. Their bulgogi fries are to die for, and like I said it's one of the best fries you can get in Vegas.

But sadly, it is not the same as the original komex. Maybe its the lack of workers? But it seemed like it took FOREVERRRR to get my food here. Along with re fills of my precious water. Maybe it's because I came in during lunch and there was only one person working. But still there were probably only three customers in total. That and the prices are totally raised up from what they were two years ago.

Still....those damn bulgogi fries hold a special place in my heart.

Prooo tip: If you're in a rush call in advance and you can pick up the food!!!!

I'd heard about KoMex a couple of years ago, from a friend.  Its been on my bookmarks list for ages, and this past weekend, we finally decided to check it out.

We got there about 4pm on a Friday night, and the place was completely empty.  
The space is very big, and open.  Its bright, and clean. 

We were greeted and given chips and salsa (and guac, but we had her take that back due to my allergy.)  The chips were great, and we were told that they make them in house.

I'd already glanced at the menu online, but they had a couple things that hadn't been listed online...like the Bulgogi Tater.  
A huge skillet filled with tater tots, bulgogi beef, smokey pork belly, bacon, sour cream, cheese, and green onions...I had to try this.   It was absolutely delicious, but I won't order it again unless I have 2-3 more people to share it with, it was enormous.  

I also went with the bulgogi beef fusion taco.  My husband had a bulgogi beef fusion, pork belly fusion and shrimp fusion taco.  The shrimp taco he had on a lettuce wrap.  (More like a lettuce cup.

I had anticipated small street tacos like I'm used to at other taco shops.  
Not these...these were much bigger than anticipated, and packed full of flavor.  
The bulgogi was sweet and tender.  The slaw was a perfect compliment.  The shrimp was PERFECTLY cooked.  

My fella also ordered the wonton soup, and this was a revelation.  Light fragrant broth.  Tender wontons.  Absolutely delicious. 

Service was friendly and quick, and the price can't be beat. 

I was extremely pleased with my visit, and will definitely be back.

I've bookmarked this place for... i'd say over 2 years but was never able to try it until my recent trip to vegas. I'd say the dishes are $7+ (except the tacos). I got the bulgogi fries and it was preeeettty spicy. So if you're not into spicy, ask for the jalapenos to be removed but I'm unsure if they're able to do that.. so maybe ask. My cousin tried the pastrami (but it's bulgogi) sandwich and it was delicious. That was around $9.. +tax. My brother got half portion of the fried rice and it was delicious as well. All of the stuff we ordered were really large portions. I couldn't finish the fries so I shared it with my boyfriend. My cousin only ate 3/4 of his bulgogi sandwich and let us all take a bite out of it. 

Oh, and complimentary chips and salsa (and guac). 

I liked it but didn't love it.
Best kept secret in Vegas!!! Korean/Mexican fusion is a unique/delicious concept.  The Chow Fettuccini is a must try!

Korean Mexican fusion. You can't go wrong with that combination!

The bulgolgi fries or nachos is definitely recommended!
Just how I want my food Mexican Korean yum. I recommend this place. Korean food and Mexican food. Best of both worlds. It's just a pricey but other than that it's good.

Items ordered:
Chips and Salsa
Fusion Burrito - Chicken with Mexican Rice, Green & Brown Onions, Pico de Gallo, Cilantro, Lettuce
Fusion Flauta - Bulgogi plus Cheese rolled in Flour Tortillas & deep fried plus fusion Guacamole
Fusion Slider - Bulgogi plus Mayo, Lettuce, Onions, Tomato, Korean Hot Sauce
Orange

A locally owned institution, the "Korean, Mexican, American" concept proudly promoted on outdoor signage, it was finally on Thursday that KoMex Fusion proved interesting enough to investigate, a two o'clock in the afternoon arrival finding several menu-options unavailable even as the restaurant seemed sorely lacking for patrons.

Officially location number two, the North Decatur original spawning a sibling spot in late 2013, those entering Komex Fusion on South Buffalo are promptly greeted by a server/hostess standing at the kitchen-front podium, a sprawl of tables laid-out right and left with a bar showing sports providing alternative entertainment to the overly-loud IHeartRadio soundtrack.

Asked whether dine-in or to-go, the choice to stay followed by a gesture to sit anywhere one likes, it was with menu and water soon in hand that choices were debated, the idea of Mexican Meat-market owners spinning Asian suggesting a little from each column, though the decision was immediately nullified when the server announced they were "all out" of Noodles.

Essentially removing 1/8 of the menu, a suggestion that "Fusion Fries" could somehow replace Fettuccine a bizarre one indeed, it was instead Mexican and American that tastes trended, a three-item order tallying just over $17 after tax and tip.

Happy that single tastes of several items are available, no up-charge compared to larger plates, lunch began with a Fusion Slider featuring marinated Beef atop a soft Bun with traditional condiments and Korean Hot Sauce, the heat actually quite mild just as it was when rolled in a crispy Tortilla with a dollop of chopped Avocado.

Amused by the teensy cup of Salsa served with complimentary Chips, especially when accounting for large portions and low prices across the menu, it was next in an enormous Burrito that appetite was invested, the "spicy Pork" eschewed in favor of Chicken that was unfortunately a bit gristly, the addition of Mexican Rice an Grilled onions none-too-different from a ten-plus year recollection of Chipotle with added disappointment provided by the fact that the Korean Pancake dessert was "unavailable," just some complimentary Orange slices to finish instead of an outsourced "Cronut Sundae."

**Understanding that specials sometimes sell-out, but never understanding the point of a laminated menu with unavailable options, KoMex success seems largely attributable to big portions and low prices, a one-and-done sort of place in a city with no lack of more delicious and authentic low-cost dining options.

My group and I ate lunch here before we left Vegas. I gotta say, it definitely did not disappoint! While we were waiting for the food, we were presented with plates of tortilla chips, guacamole and salsa. It was quite addicting and almost made us forget that we were waiting for food. 

We got the fusion burrito (consisted of bulgogi, rice, lettuce and pico de gallo), pork belly tacos, beef bulgogi rice plate, pork belly musubi (warning: these are HUGE) and kimchi fried rice with spam and spicy pork (topped off with a huge fried egg). 

Portions were huge and we all left with happy, full stomachs. Service was awesome--our waitress was super patient and sweet and never hesitated to refill our drinks.
Got the Kimchi friedrice 3 meat combo.. its pretty good.. one of the spot i go to when craving for that korean/spanish food.. lol

At first me and my boyfriend didn't find this place appealing but we went ahead and gave it a shot and I'm glad we did! They give out free chips and salsa/guan and an orange for dessert  we got the spicy pork chimichanga and it was pretty delish! It wasn't AMAZING but I would order it again. Must try this place!!

I was hoping that komex would be really good but to me it was just okay. My friend tho did really like it but I didn't find it to be outstanding. The reviews seem overrated. In Los Angeles tons of fusion tacos places.
I  ordered the beef chow fettuccini the flavor was decent but way over salty in my opinion if it was so salty I would have enjoyed it more. I also didn't find the bulgogi in the fettuccini that great. 

I also ordered a beef fusion taco and a pork belly taco, again it was okay I found  the meats we're bit dry in the taco. Honestly I have made better fusion taco using Korean marinated  beef short ribs and then adding guacamole, sour cream and siracha with cucumbers. 

My friend ordered a chicken fusion french fries that was not bad. 

I may go back and try something else what I oredered I wasn't impressed.
This was really good. I reccomend the tacos. It's basically Korean seasoned beef on a taco. Disclaimer I really like Mexican food and have also liked Korean food the few times I've had it.

This is really one of my favorite places to eat anywhere on the world. The Kim Chee fried rice is at least as good if not better than what I have had in Hawaii and even Macau.  What makes it better is the great staff, thoughtful desert, price, and selection of food you can't get anywhere. This time I also tried a calamari steak taco. Better than any fish taco I have ever had.  The portions are gigantic too. I always end up taking food home.  This new location is super clean and they have one of the best bathrooms I have been in.  You'll just have to check it out.  6 stars.
This place is amazing! Food is delicious, drinks are delicious, full bar and atmosphere is clean and stylish :) got the fusion chimichanga and fusion enchilada

I had there chicken, and beef fusion tacos and a single bulgogi beef slider which were all excellent. I brought home a fusion beef burrito w/ kimchi and it was large and on point also. The bulgogi beef is very tender and tasty. Almost everything on their menu Kimchi can be added if your a Kimchi fan. Good food, give them a try.

We usually go to the other location when we are in town but it was closed for the holidays so we found ourselves here.  We love their complimentary chips, salsa and guacamole.  We ordered the two meat burrito, two bulgogi lettuce tacos and the bulgogi rice plate for the kids to share.  Always good food, good portions, for a great price.  The manager and the waitress were working hard, giving good attentive service.  Probably go again today because the wife loves their food!

Komex is delicious! It's our favorite restaurant in Vegas! There isn't a bad thing on the menu. I have had the fusion chimi, fusion torta, fusion nachos, fusion fries, the pbblt, bulstrami, kimchi fried rice with bulgogi and spam, my favorite the fusion tots, the mexican taco, the fusion taco and the cronut dessert all of which is amazing! We take all of our friends and family when they are in town and have yet to hear one complaint. The prices are also very reasonable so if you like Asian food and Mexican food you really can't go wrong. The staff is also very friendly!

We've come here a few times.mainly because we were in the area. I'm glad this location is consistent about their food as their original location. It's always disappointing when restaurants expand and it lost its own recipe somehow. Like somebody in the kitchen started cooking and throwing ingredients from the top of their head.

I don't know if the husband and wife alternates, but each time it's the wife running it. 

Service is good here. This location serves beer unlike it's smaller location. The better reason to visit this location is that it's way bigger than the Decatur one. Makes it a lot more stroller and group friendly! 

Still highly recommend giving them a shot. We don't have a very large array of fusion food out here so just having komex as a sitdown option is awesome for us! And I swear their oranges at the end are always sweet! 

Definitely kid and stroller friendly!

Enjoy!
Soo many review I'll keep it short. Good food good prices and perfect mix of quantity/quality Mexican/Korean flavor

I'm usually a frequenter of their Decatur location, but this one is actually nicer in appearance and area, and the food is just as good! Oh man those Bulgogi Flautas, I rave about them every chance I get, and they pair perfectly with the guac that comes with them. Now I want them again.

My favorite 2 types of foods. Mmm so good. I accidentally ordered a lot of food. The veggie chow fettuccine was that flat rice noodles. It taste like chow mein but different in a very good way. The fusion chimichanga was so delicious with the red sauce that's poured on top of it. I loved how the cheese was still melted with the beef. Customer service was fantastic. The lady was helpful and cheerfully friendly. I definitely will come back and recommend friends to go. Also I saw a sign there from 3 to 6 is half off beer. Might have to take a look into that.
This place has a very interesting menu. Something very unique. The staff was very friendly and the food was really good.

Cool spot good good food I suggest the fajita plate it's not on the menu but SO MUCH FLAVOR YUMMMMM! Environment is a bit boring but you can watch games there they have a bar! I would give it 5 stars if they livened it up a bit
Great little place with great food for lunch!!  Just the right amount of fusion in my enchiladas!!  Service is great too.
This place has some awesome food!  It's a great idea, Korean and Mexican Fusion.  What a great concept.  I really enjoy it and it's reasonably priced too.

Wow.   A co-worker introduced me to this little gem.  Unassuming place in a strip mall on Buffalo.   Clean inside and lovely people working there.  

Was not quite sure what I expected from a Korean/Mexican fusion restaurant but it was a blast.  The people running this place are very warm and inviting.  They make you feel very welcome.  

The food was really good, served hot and there was plenty of it.  I ordered a beef dish with chicken fried rice and enjoyed it very much.  This place was quite a surprise and I will darken the door here again!   If you want a different meal in a nice, clean, friendly, small little place that offers a blend of Korean foods and Mexican faire, you cannot go wrong with KoMex Fusion.

Korean + Mexican = KoMex. 

A lot of my friends had been raving about this place I was excited to have finally gotten a chance to visit and it didn't disappoint. We went on a Saturday night about an hour before they closed and it wasn't very busy. Although, it did take a while for our order to be taken, it was okay because it gave us time to look over the menu.

1. Fusion Tostada w/ spicy pork, Korean Slaw, crispy rice "tortilla", and pico de gallo - the pork was tender, sweet, and spicy, the rice was simultaneously crispy and chewy in a good way. The slaw and the pico added acidity to cut through the richness of the pork and rice. Overall 4/5

2. Pork Belly Musubi - I had a problem with this. The pork was dry and had very little flavor and the sauce in it was pretty bland. Overall 2/5

3. Beef Bulgogi Cheesesteak w/fries - this was a delicious cheesesteak. The bulgogi marinade was slightly sweet, the cheese was gooey and melty and the roll it was served on was soft and warm. They didn't skimp on the meat either. The fries were basic frozen and unsalted. If you're going to get the cheesesteak I would save the extra money on the fries. Overall 4/5

4. Kimchi Fried Rice - the presentation was beautiful. There aren't many things that have a fried egg on it that don't look amazing. This was no exception. The kimchi was funky, spicy, and fermented in a very delicious savory way, the bulgogi added a sweetness to cut the funkiness of the kimchi, the egg was a perfect sunny side up. Overall 4.5/5

We ordered a lot of food and the prices were very reasonable. We ordered 5 items (I'm only reviewing 4) and everything came out around $45 before tip. 

Tip: If you're a soda drinker they serve their drinks by the can, so if you get thirsty order a water also.
Great food. Obviously it's Korean and Mexican fusion. This is the second day straight I've showed up here.  Food comes in at a good rate and prices are very, very reasonable.

Oh KoMex, I'm not sure about you!

KoMex combines my two most favorite cusines, Mexican (actually, Tex-Mex) and Korean. Unfortunately, the food at this location missed the mark. 

I came here with my Yelp Husband (aka, +1 to everything) Justin G. on 5/17/14 for a late lunch/early dinner. We've both been to the other location, but seeing as it is nowhere near either of our homes, we settled here.

We ordered a half size order of bulgogi nachos with kimchee, I ordered beef noodles with kimchee and Justin got a bulgogi torta.

Only one person was working and there were 3 other tables with people so service was a bit chaotic and took a while. When the woman working came by to refill our waters, she said our fry nachos would be out soon. I said, "We ordered regular nachos, not fry nachos." She said, "Oh, that's right. Regular nachos. I don't know why I said fry nachos." She brought us out a plate of fry nachos. We didn't say anything because we had just had that exchange.

Don't get the fry nachos. Justin picked off all the kimchee because he said it made it too wet. I ate his kimchee instead (which is very tasty!) 

My pasta was forgettable. We were so busy talking that I don't really remember any flavors, and that was my opinion right after I noticed that I had eaten everything off of my plate. Justin said nothing of his torta but he had basically deconstructed the whole thing on his plate so, I don't take that as the best sign.

I might be back, but our last meal doesn't have me in any hurry.
I can't stop eating here.  Low key and delicious spicy food.  Salsa is full of flavor as is everything else.  Friendly and efficient service for a fast lunch.

It was my intention to find a decent combination of Korean and Mexican food when I visited this establishment a couple of days ago. Sadly I did not find that here. The servers were friendly, and the location on Flamingo and Buffalo was easy enough to find. However, the food was lacking. 

I tried their chicken chimichanga. The only thing that seemed to make it different from a typical one was that it had a sort of shredded cabbage dressing on top. Perhaps this was the bulgoli (spelling?) that they said it would have. The shell of the chimichanga was soft which indicated it wasn't really fried and crisp like it should have been. I will say that the chicken was cooked well which is something of a positive I suppose. 

All in all, I wouldn't give this place another shot. I've had good Korean/Mexican fusion before but this is not it. Hopefully there's something else in town that can do better!

First time going here and I was blown away! Entered and was greeted immediately. We got to choose where to sit and their menu is clean and simple. Me and my friend ordered the:
Fusion (beef) Enchilada Plate $8.00
(3 Rolled Tacos in Corn Tortillas topped with Red Sauce & Cheese) with Mexican Rice and the Fusion Nachos/ Fusion Fries combined 1/2 Nacho - 1/2 Fry COMBO $11.00 Meat, Mozzarella Cheese, Pico de Gallo, Jalapeno & Korean Hot Sauce

While waiting we were given a basket of chips, salsa, and guacamole. Chips were stale and the sauces were okay. Food came in within 10 minutes and the portion sizes were not too big yet not too little. It was perfect! Nacho/fries fusion was so delicious. You can taste the marinated bulgogi and the mix of cheese, korean hot sause, and pico de gallo. It was the perfect flavor combination. We ate the plate clean ;)
As for the enchilada plate, it was also good but not my favorite. Bulgogi was spot on and the rice was okay. 

Paid $21 for a very filling, satisfying lunch for two. Not bad I must say! Going here more often now!

I remember first discovering this place some months ago when it first opened. I have to give Yelp credit for always being my guiding light ;-) We literally ate here once a week for a couple of months and I eat out pretty sparingly. It felt like an addiction that only those fusion nachos can cure!  The bulgogi nachos are the star IMO. The freshly fried chips, sweet and salty bulgogi beef, fresh pico and a drizzle of spicy sauce is fusion perfection. And who would have thought mozzarella cheese over korean beef would even be appropriate? The full portion is so large I always share, throw in a coupla fish tacos and call it a meal. I really like their version of the fish taco. The shrimp is ok. We've also tried their fried rice. It is extra fragrant from the sesame oil and very welcoming at first, but after several bites and a cooler temp it the sesame smell and taste becomes overpowering. I have yet to try the kimchi fried rice but after the nachos there is just no room!  The complimentary chips and guac is a nice addition to the already affordable pricing and the fried wontons are really cheap and good as well. I think there are 5 for like $1.50!!

Their homemade salsa and sauces are really good
 The salsa verde-ish one is my favorite. Green in color almost like salsa verde but some pungeant asian notes in it as well. The sauce caddies used to be on the tables but now I notice that you have to ask for it. Even then, each jar is only a bout a quarter full. I think some people got a little too crazy and wasteful  with the sauce.  I wish they would add in a soda fountain and stop serving cans of soda. Other than that, I really love this place!

I'm new to Vegas and wanted to try something new. Korean/ Mexican Fusion is totally new for me. I asked the waitress what is the most popular dish. She mentioned that the Fusion Tostado was featured on one of the Food Network shows. Its only $5 and its delicious & filling! They are very gracious on serving size. I took my sister and her husband (who live in LA) here and they've already want to head out here again the next time they visit. Try it. You might like it.

Went here with a bunch of friends on a Friday night about 830pm. I found it kind of strange that they close at 9pm, but we made it in the door. There's probably 15 or so tables available, but only a few were occupied.

Our group ordered bulgogi nachos, several varieties of tacos ($2 ea), pork belly and bulgogi skewers ($3 ea), a bulgogi rice bowl, and a big pineapple filled with liquor. Nachos were good, with plenty of peppers that I had to work around. 7/10

Tacos were really good, small in size but packed full of flavor. 9/10

Skewers looked great and full of meat. I didn't eat them but I would definitely order them next time because I love meat on a stick.

My friend who wasn't hungry at 3/4 of the rice bowl, so it must have been good. Served with a sunny side up egg on top for $9.

Place is clean, serves alcohol (beer and wine) which I was told the other location doesn't. I'm definitely coming back for those skewers.

Clean restaurant, good food seasoned well, large portions.  I am a fan! The beef bulgogi plate and the pork bulgogi plate are both very good and I recommend trying both of these meat plates.  If you spring for the fried rice, it is delicious!  I recommend giving this place a try for a good meal at a good price when you are in the mood for something casual yet adventurous.

yum. yum. yum. YUM! This place is delicious. I mean delicioso... Err I meant to say . Okay, well whatever your language or culinary persuasion is (providing it's within the confines of Korean and/or Mexican cuisine) this place has something for you! 

I walk in with my mom and we were immediately greeted by our waitress, host, and presumed owner (I'm sure this is a family joint) & were seated at our table with a view of their awesome flat screen showing college basketball. I'm in love already. Oh wait, you want to hear about food right? Okay gotchya! 

Browsing through the menu, they have all kinds of awesome options. I opted for the korean wings with seasoned French fries. The sauce on these was incredible, nothing to overbearing, but a little sweet... A little spicy... With some sesame seed. Mmmm. My mom got the bulgolgi chicken enchiladas. The marinade on these was succulent, and the rice truly ties this dish together. 

Next time I'm getting the bulgolgi nachos or the bulgogi combo plate... With stir get veggies!!!! So epic. #supportsmallbiz

While I am a big fan of the original KoMex Fusion on Decatur, I had never dined at this newer and more commodious location before.  After stopping here for dinner on the way back to North Las Vegas from California, I am pleased to report that the inventive choices, quality, and taste of the food sampled, and the attentive service to be encountered here are just as stellar and sensational as one will find at the original Asian/Mexican fusion namesake standard bearer across town.     

The first decisions were the hardest: whether to order the full bowl and platter versions or smaller quantities.  Since I was going to enjoy two dishes, I decided to order half portions.  And am I glad I did!

My steaming Wonton Soup with the almost bottomless stone half-bowl (much larger than a cup) carried a heavy load of chicken broth along with 4 large delectable wontons stuffed with beef, pork, mushrooms, egg and onions.  (The larger version sports 8 such filled wontons, and must be boat sized.)  This came on top of the complimentary platter of homemade Tortilla Chips & housemade Salsa.  When I asked for some Guacamole, that of course also arrived without charge, and was a delicious concoction of avocado, diced tomatoes, White Onion, and cilantro seasoned with a modulated and well-controlled spicy kick.

When at length I finished my hot and very tasty soup, I was presented with a small but heaping and steaming platter of Combo Chow Fettuccine with some added Kimchi thrown in on request.  The Kimchi, too, was happily provided without charge.  Since this entree was big enough to easily satisfy two, its larger cousin must effortlessly accommodate four hungry diners.  

This main was an interesting combination of thick noodles laced with lean beef, chicken, and fairly sizable shrimp mixed with cabbage, Green Onions, multi-colored Bell Pepper, Carrots, and an Asian sauce.  A little Soy Sauce added some welcome salt, and I proceeded to dispatch this inviting and delicious melange of pasta with heavy Asian accents.  Meanwhile, across from me Diane really liked her Shrimp Quesadilla prepared with an abundance of chopped shrimp and oozing Mozzarella Cheese.  She was barely able to finish it--but she eventually did.  

After meal's end we were surprised by yet another complimentary treat: refrigerated and pre-cut fresh orange slices impaled with decorated toothpicks.  It was a refreshing end to a superior repast.

Five stars all the way!  I'll soon be back--you can bet on it!

We've been eating at Komex for 3 years...first the old location and now this one.  We absolutely love the owners and the food!  Their Korean meat and kimchi are some of the best in the city.  This is the closet to my mom's home cooking (real Korean food...not Americanized sauces and marinades).  They know us by name and have seen me pregnant with cravings to watching our kids grow.  It's a family place and couldn't feel more like home. 

The only downside for me personally is I wish they had a full Korean menu to satisfy all my cravings!  I just know they'd be amazing!
The food was delicious.  I never thought Korean and Mexican could be fused. But Komex proved me wring. Great flavors. Be sure to try the Korean Hot Sauce, it was yummy on the food.

Love this place... fast and flavorful! My go to is the bulgogi burrito... delicious delicious  with a side of kimchi. You can't go wrong here. The interior is a bit outdated but don't let that fool you. The food makes up for it

This is one of my favorite restaurants to eat at especially when I'm pregnant. I'm not as daring as my husband, I stick to the Asian menu.  I always order the same thing: Chicken Bulogi, Fish Tacos, Kimchee Fried Rice, Wonton Soup and the Chow Fun. The staff is very friendly and I can't wait to try their Soju-tini!

Me, my brother, and my cousin hit this spot up. We sat at the bar ordered 2 rounds of Hite and a couple shots of soju. 

I ordered a bulgogi taco, a calamari taco, a bulgogi flauta, and a pork belly taco. 

My bro got a shrimp taco, bulgogi taco, and 2 pork belly tacos. 

My cuz got the bulgogi burrito. 

The chips salsa and guacamole were good. 

The bulgogi was dry and it was not marinated long enough. 

The calamari taco was excellent. 

My bro gave me one of the shrimp from his taco and it was tender and good. 

The flauta was dry to me and with the bulgogi not being marinated long enough it didn't work to me and I had to add guacamole and sour cream to every bite to finish it. 

I think the crown jewel was the pork belly tacos. The pork was thick cut and had a smokey flavor to it. I mixed a couple of the salsas together and it rounded out the taco nicely.


I like this spot!
I had their bulgogi cheesesteak and fries. I loved how crispy the fries were. Service was awesome too.

I love komex fusion.  Great servings for the dollar i brought my girlfriend and friend and they loved it.  They serve with salsa and tortilla chips with the order.  Cash is king because they charge for card transactions

This is my new go to place. Everything was delicious. The fusion wings are to die for, the fusion fries are also to die for and we had the cheesesteak which was excellent. You get a basket of chips guacamole and salsa the soon as you sit down. We had a calamari and shrimp taco that were so good probably some of the best tacos I've had in Vegas. And make sure you ask them for the little turntable of hot sauces because they are also to die for. I will definitely come back over and over again.

Today is a day packed with first for me.  First time trying the new Cookie Butter shaved snow at SnowFlake Shavery (get it with Oreo and Caramel Sauce).  Then after dessert dinner at the new Komex location that just opened today!  Ordered the Beef Chow Fettuccine, another first for me. And also the Daeji Bulgogi (Pork) Nacho, possible a first for me again.  Yep.  1st. First. ???. #1? Four 1sts, not very lucky for a Taiwanese person. 

I can also add not knowing about this "grand opening" of the new Komex second location to the list of my many first too. Making it a not lucky, but more importantly not unlucky 5 firsts kinda day. 

So I came here after getting some desserts.  One of my friends, Will, was disappointed with the pho he just had at one of the local Vietnamese restaurants.  Michael K was down for some dinner.  So I just tagged along, even though I should have stopped after taking on a Monster.  The real secret to my girlish figure (just for Tu Anh), SnowFlake meal replacement, but you have to have it plain without the condensed milk (exception for the nuts as toppings is okay).

The restaurant is huge compared to their first location, even though it has the same capacity.  The decoration is minimalistic but still Fluffy-approved, a lot of bamboo related decor. 

After looking over the menu, we decided to just ordered two full sized items.  It was a good thing too, because I didn't feel like batting cleanup or having leftover.  Simply put, you get a lot of food for what you are paying.  A definite plus for feeding a family or large group on a nominal budget.

The Chow Fettuccine with Beef was good (just $8.50 for a full order). Nice flavor, but I felt it was on the greasy side.  We still killed it like it was one of Michael K's famous Macha Cheesecake with Strawberries.

The Daeji Bulgogi (Pork) Nacho is big too.  Flavor and freshness of the ingredients are good, I just wanted more of the meat along with the salsa, cheese, etc. with my nacho.

Service was great. The waitress,in spite of having just a tenure of 3 whole days or 72 hours or less, was impressively knowledgeable about the menu and the questions the others threw her way.  Food came out fairly fast, even though some thought we would be waiting forever because of that party of 20 that was seated ahead of us.

Overall, I enjoyed the experience here, food could be better, but still a good time getting mild verbal abuse from a good friend about giving up on liberty and the pursuit of happiness, and possible 6-figure annual income leasing out my soul to Wall Street.

Even though it took over from a defunct bar, and the bar is still there, no alcohol is currently being served here.  Beer and wine liquor license is in the works, until then order a kids friendly beverage.

3.5 stars.  Can't beat the portions you get here, and a definite must for people that wants leftover so they don't have to cook for the next 1.5 days.

Great service, great food, great prices!

They'll start you off with complimentary tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole (Delicious!). Something to definitely try are their Fusion Fries! I like bulgogi (Korean marinated beef) on it with extra jalapenos. Also, their Fusion Fried Rice (Chicken, Spicy Pork, or Beef). Tacos are good and so are their burritos. The restaurant is always clean and the staff has always been great to me. 

I've enjoyed the gritty Korean/Mexican fusion food trucks like Bool and Kogi since I've lived in L.A., and even though Komex's tacos and burritos aren't as good, they still do other things really well.

Love the bigger restaurant, I can bring my kids in for a meal.  Our prior visit was to the other store and we had to get it take out.  Highly recommend the tostada, so unique.  We are really enjoyed the fried wontons and at $1.50 for 5, they are a great deal.   The kids really enjoyed the chicken quesadillas, the chicken was super moist and tasty.  The wings were another hit with the family.  If you are wanting a unique experience and some great flavors, this is the place to go.

My whole family loves Komex, and my three boys can be picky eaters. Try anything with the bulgogi beef. I have eaten at this location 4 times for dinner, and the Decator location a dozen times and never had a bad meal.

I have to admit, I wasn't thrilled with my first encounter with the original Komex location. So I wasn't as excited as most when they opened up a new location closer to me. I have always wanted to give them another chance so when I saw their discounted tacos available during their three-year anniversary celebration, I took it as a sign that it was time to give them another try.

We ordered some tacos and a large fried rice to share. Since tacos were only $1 we got two each and figured we would have plenty of rice to take home as leftovers. Boy were we right about that. Our food arrived and the rice was enormous, so were the tacos. For just $15 and change we got enough food for lunch and dinner along with drinks and chips with salsa and guacamole. 

On my previous visit, I had tried nachos and a burrito and didn't love the flavor combinations. This time I was much more impressed with the tacos and fried rice, probably because they were simpler and cleaner flavors. 

I'll definitely be back now that they're in my neck of the woods.
Love this place ! My fav, is the kimchi fried rice ! Easy parking, great service. Staff always pleasant !! Highly recommend !

Was happy to find out that KoMex has a second location in Las Vegas!!  Have loved going to their original location ever since I started Yelping!!  First thing I noticed upon entering is that this restaurant is much bigger than the original.  Also, they have a bar here!  

Came between lunch and dinner time so no fighting for a table!  Score!!  I am a fan of KoMex because they have good service, are affordably priced, and they make some of the best food anywhere!!

For our first visit to this new location, my wife ordered a breakfast entree.  Well, I do not recall the exact name of her entree.  I think it was some sort of breakfast dish.  I has the chance to try a couple of bites, and it was good.  

I ordered my absolute favorite item of theirs.  The Bulgogi Nachos!!  Everything looked the same, but I did not quite get the same satisfaction this time around.  I was not wowed, but it was still very good.  Flavorful and filling.  Don't know what was missing from making it a completely gratifying experience.  Guess I'm used to patronizing their old locale. 

Look forward to making more trips here in the future whenever we travel to Vegas.  So convenient to have them closer to the Strip.  Korean Mexican Fusion dining doesn't get any better than visiting one of their restaurants.  Give them a try!  More than likely, you will not regret it!!

This was everything I've ever wanted in a restaurant. 

The flavors, the service, the price, the extras, the creativity, the portion. It was all there!

Our waitress was super helpful in choosing dishes. We got the fusion fries and fusion tacos. She told us which sauces paired well with which foods. 

The food was super hot and was a huge portion. Total for 2 was $14! What?! So good.

They have your free chips, salsa, guac, and a sliced orange. 

Def coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

So. Good. Seriously. So good.

This new location is dangerously close to my bf's house and it has become a staple in our diet. I mean, where else can we get delicious fusion food we both enjoy that fills us both up for $15? It's ridiculous.

My favorites are the chicken fusion tostada and the fusion pork belly tacos. That crunch they develop on the rice tostada is just delicious and provides a much needed textural component to that dish. And the pork belly tacos are just yummy goodness. I mean, it's pork belly.

My only complaint is my breath seriously smells like onion for a whole day after eating here cause of the asian slaw. Good thing the bf and I both eat here so we both have onion breath!

But this location is much more convenient for me than the other, and it's significantly larger with more seating area as well. I have been and will continue to be a Komex fan.

Maaaan, oh man! This is definitely going on the list of places to hit up again next time we're in Vegas. We got the tots with bulgogi on top as an appetizer and I got the PBBBLT sandwich. Gave  1/2 to my cousin so I can also eat a Korean taco . Yes I know that was very glutinous of me, but it was worth the extra workout.
Dood.....this place is super legit! Beef bulgogi burrito for the win! I will definitely come back!
Simply put.. Amazing!! Awkward when you first walk in and not sure where to sit.  a little sketchy of a shopping center.  Try the Musabi w/ egg!
